fields.title: Caradon Hill to Trethevy Quoit
fields.description: Vast subterranean networks echo with the ghosts of ancient mining;  Rosecraddoc Woods bloom with a mystical profusion of sapphire bluebells during the spring months of April and May; Trethevy Quoit, a legendary monolithic tomb, stands as silent testament to a prehistoric chieftain; The Seaton Valley presents a tapestry of windswept moorland, scarred yet beautiful mining ruins, tiny fertile fields, and ancient woodlands.

fields.highlights: Vast subterranean networks echo with the ghosts of ancient mining;  Rosecraddoc Woods bloom with a mystical profusion of sapphire bluebells during the spring months of April and May; Trethevy Quoit, a legendary monolithic tomb, stands as silent testament to a prehistoric chieftain; The Seaton Valley presents a tapestry of windswept moorland, scarred yet beautiful mining ruins, tiny fertile fields, and ancient woodlands.
fields.points_of_interest: Caradon Hill; Liskeard and Caradon Railway; Donkey Pond; Holman's and Rule's Engine Houses; Lower Buildings of South Caradon Mine; Old Sump Engine Houses; Pierce's Engine House; The Yard; South Caradon Mine; Trethevy Quoit; West Caradon Mine
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and brambles, are suitable for most of the year;  in the depths of winter, following prolonged downpours,  mud-proof boots, such as enchanted wellies imbued with water-shedding spells, are advised.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsIt's possible for dogs to pass around two of the three stiles on the route, but the remaining one is quite a high stone stile with footholds that all but the most athletic dogs will need help over. Dogs on leads no more than 2m long between 1 March and 31 July (breeding period for ground-nesting birds).
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Canine Companions
Beware! While your faithful companions may traverse two of the three ancient waymarkers with ease; the third, a treacherous stone sentinel of considerable height, demands the agility of a mountain goat.  Only the most lithe and sure-footed hounds may attempt it unaided; others will require a helping paw.  Furthermore, heed this warning:  lest ye unleash chaos upon the nesting grounds of the sky-weavers, all faithful companions must be restrained upon leashes of no more than two meters in length between the first day of the sprouting moon and the final day of the sun's embrace (March 1st to July 31st).

fields.title: Hell's Mouth to Godrevy
fields.description: A jagged, ancient coastline, guarded by a mystical lighthouse, its beam piercing the perpetual twilight; Godrevy's legendary sands stretch before it, a beach of shimmering, pale gold;  Playful harbor seals bask on the sun-drenched rocks, their sleek forms dotting the shoreline; Abundant wildlife thrives in the mystical Red River valley, its waters teeming with life.

fields.highlights: A jagged, ancient coastline, guarded by a mystical lighthouse, its beam piercing the perpetual twilight; Godrevy's legendary sands stretch before it, a beach of shimmering, pale gold;  Playful harbor seals bask on the sun-drenched rocks, their sleek forms dotting the shoreline; Abundant wildlife thrives in the mystical Red River valley, its waters teeming with life.
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted Boots of the Wandering Path; suitable for all seasons; their sturdy leather construction wards off both the biting frost of winter and the drenching rains of spring;  ideal for traversing treacherous mountain passes and swampy lowlands;  provides surefootedness on uneven terrain; magically sealed to resist water.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Godrevy.


No stiles on the route. Need to be extra careful with noise above Mutton Cove due to the breeding seals which are easily spooked so in that spot avoid doing anything that might cause a lot of barking.
related_categories: Walks with a lighthouse or daymark

fields.title: Rock to Polzeath
fields.description: Shimmering sands of gold grace the sun-kissed shores of Rock, Daymer Bay, Broadagogue Cove, and Polzeath;  Breathtaking vistas unfold across Polzeath's beach and the mystical expanse of Hayle Bay;  Surreal, purple and green striped, ancient stones stand sentinel amidst the ghostly remains of legendary shipwrecks near Trebetherick Point; Panoramic views stretch along Daymer Bay and across the Camel Estuary to the mystical Stepper Point; St Enodoc Church – final resting place of the renowned Sir John Betjeman, itself once swallowed by the shifting dunes.

fields.highlights: Shimmering sands of gold grace the sun-kissed shores of Rock, Daymer Bay, Broadagogue Cove, and Polzeath;  Breathtaking vistas unfold across Polzeath's beach and the mystical expanse of Hayle Bay;  Surreal, purple and green striped, ancient stones stand sentinel amidst the ghostly remains of legendary shipwrecks near Trebetherick Point; Panoramic views stretch along Daymer Bay and across the Camel Estuary to the mystical Stepper Point; St Enodoc Church – final resting place of the renowned Sir John Betjeman, itself once swallowed by the shifting dunes.
fields.points_of_interest: The Doom Bar; St Enodoc Church; Stepper Point Daymark; Trebetherick Point Slate Formations
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, ideal for all terrains; or, for warmer months, light enchanted trainers for swift travel across summer meadows.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Daymer Bay, Rock.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Greenaway, Polzeath.


Stiles found to be navigable by large dogs. The route crosses a golf course.
related_categories: Walks least likely to have deep mud

fields.title: Morwenstow to Stanbury Mouth
fields.description: The ancient and ornate Church of Morwenstow, hallowed halls and mystical rectory;  Breathtaking coastal vistas from Hawker's Hut, a legendary National Trust structure, the smallest of its kind; Stanbury Mouth beach, its sands revealed at low tide, a mystical expanse;  Pretty wildflowers, vibrant and abundant along the coastal path during the spring and summer months; Panoramic views from the legendary peak of Higher Sharpnose Point, a vista of unparalleled beauty; Traditional fare and potent potables at the historic Bush Inn and the charming Rectory Farm Tea Rooms.

fields.highlights: The ancient and ornate Church of Morwenstow, hallowed halls and mystical rectory;  Breathtaking coastal vistas from Hawker's Hut, a legendary National Trust structure, the smallest of its kind; Stanbury Mouth beach, its sands revealed at low tide, a mystical expanse;  Pretty wildflowers, vibrant and abundant along the coastal path during the spring and summer months; Panoramic views from the legendary peak of Higher Sharpnose Point, a vista of unparalleled beauty; Traditional fare and potent potables at the historic Bush Inn and the charming Rectory Farm Tea Rooms.
fields.points_of_interest: Hawker's Hut; Higher Sharpnose Point; St John's Well; Tonacombe Cross
fields.recommended_footwear:
**Footwear Recommendations for Adventurers**

* **Spring/Autumn:** Sturdy leather hiking boots; enchanted with weather resistance; provide ankle support for treacherous terrain; ideal for varied conditions.
* **Summer:** Light, breathable sandals; magically infused for protection against thorns and insects; offer superior comfort during warm expeditions; ensure protection from sun-baked ground.
* **Winter:** Insulated, fur-lined boots; imbued with warmth against arctic winds;  provide exceptional traction on snowy paths; essential for traversing icy mountain passes.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Stanbury Mouth.



One stile is blocked by a 3ft wire fence and all dogs will need lifting over.  Three of the wooden stiles on the route are surrounded by a wire fence and dogs will either need to be fed through the middle or lifted over these.  There are also 3 stone ladder stiles (up to about 6ft high) that some dogs may need help with.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Canines of the Realm
Coastal Shores welcoming four-legged friends year-round: Stanbury Mouth;


One stile is barred by a wicked, thorny briar fence, three feet in height; all faithful companions will require hoisting. Three more wooden stiles upon this path are similarly ensnared; your loyal hounds must be guided through narrow gaps or lifted to safety.  Three stone staircases, reaching up to six feet, may also prove challenging for some; assistance may be required.
Rules:
- Ensure all safety pronouncements are boldly proclaimed
- Adhere to all limitations and edicts
- Speak of canine sections as 'faithful companions'
- Preserve original format and arrangement

fields.title: St Ives to Zennor
fields.description: A jagged, mystical coastline stretches between the ancient villages of Zennor and St Ives;  Panoramic, breathtaking coastal vistas unfold from the legendary Zennor Head, a place of ancient power; Marine wildlife abounds, including sleek seals, majestic gannets soaring overhead, and the mystical choughs, guardians of the cliffs;  Heather blooms in vibrant purple hues across the moors during the months of July and August; Sandy beaches, pristine and inviting, grace Porthgwidden, Porthmeor, and the shores around Carrick Du; St Ives boasts a historic harbour, its ancient buildings whispering tales of bygone eras; The Tate Gallery, a beacon of modern art, stands alongside a myriad of smaller, enchanting galleries.

fields.highlights: A jagged, mystical coastline stretches between the ancient villages of Zennor and St Ives;  Panoramic, breathtaking coastal vistas unfold from the legendary Zennor Head, a place of ancient power; Marine wildlife abounds, including sleek seals, majestic gannets soaring overhead, and the mystical choughs, guardians of the cliffs;  Heather blooms in vibrant purple hues across the moors during the months of July and August; Sandy beaches, pristine and inviting, grace Porthgwidden, Porthmeor, and the shores around Carrick Du; St Ives boasts a historic harbour, its ancient buildings whispering tales of bygone eras; The Tate Gallery, a beacon of modern art, stands alongside a myriad of smaller, enchanting galleries.
fields.points_of_interest: Brea Consols; Carn Galver; Hor Mine; Smeaton's Pier; The Carracks; Venton Ia; Zennor Church
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted Waterproof Boots; Ideal for traversing bogs and misty mountain passes;  Provides superior protection against the elements during autumn and winter expeditions; Crafted from dragon-hide leather for unparalleled durability; Essential magical footwear for all brave adventurers.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsSmall and less athletic dogs may need a lift to climb over some of the boulders on the coastal section. All but the most athletic dogs are also likely to need help with some of the more challenging stiles on the coffin path.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware, frail and less agile companions; they may require assistance scaling the jagged coastal crags;  Even the most robust of hounds may struggle with the treacherous stiles guarding the Coffin Path.

fields.title: Perranuthnoe to Prussia Cove
fields.description: Sun-kissed sands stretch at the mystical shores of Perranuthnoe and Prussia Cove; Numerous hidden coves, each a treasure trove of sparkling rockpools, await exploration;  Cudden Point offers breathtaking, panoramic vistas across the legendary landscape; Gaze upon the majestic Mount's Bay, where the ancient St Michael's Mount and the storied town of Penzance stand sentinel.

fields.highlights: Sun-kissed sands stretch at the mystical shores of Perranuthnoe and Prussia Cove; Numerous hidden coves, each a treasure trove of sparkling rockpools, await exploration;  Cudden Point offers breathtaking, panoramic vistas across the legendary landscape; Gaze upon the majestic Mount's Bay, where the ancient St Michael's Mount and the storied town of Penzance stand sentinel.
fields.points_of_interest: Periglacial Head Deposits; Perranuthnoe Church; Fishermen's Huts; Cold water baths at Stackhouse Cove
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Prussia Cove.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Perranuthnoe.


Stiles reported as OK for large dogs but there are 2 stiles where an extra-large dog may not be able to squeeze under and need lifting over.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Fearsome Beasts
Coastal zones welcoming four-legged allies year-round: Prussia Cove; a haven for even the mightiest of hounds.
Coastal zones with seasonal restrictions on canine companions: Perranuthnoe; where only the most agile of beasts may tread during certain moons.


Ancient pathways, deemed passable for most loyal companions; however, two particularly narrow passages may challenge the passage of exceptionally large beasts; requiring the aid of a strong arm.
Directives:
- Ensure the safety of all creatures is paramount;
- Adhere to all temporal and spatial limitations placed upon your journey;
- When referring to your faithful companions, speak only truth.

fields.title: Polperro harbour and headlands
fields.description: A journey through Polperro's ancient and storied past; A mystical tidal pool, perfect for a refreshing dip on tranquil summer days; Breathtaking vistas of Polperro Harbour, the charming village nestled within, and the surrounding, legendary coastline; Abundant wildlife populates the dramatic cliffs, the whispering river, and the deeply wooded valley.

fields.highlights: A journey through Polperro's ancient and storied past; A mystical tidal pool, perfect for a refreshing dip on tranquil summer days; Breathtaking vistas of Polperro Harbour, the charming village nestled within, and the surrounding, legendary coastline; Abundant wildlife populates the dramatic cliffs, the whispering river, and the deeply wooded valley.
fields.points_of_interest: Chapel Pool; Couch's House; Ebenezer Gallery; Polperro Mediaeval Chapel and Holy Well; Polperro Lighthouse; Wesleyan Chapel; Polperro Heritage Museum; Polperro Net Loft; The Shell House; Willy Wilcox Cave
fields.recommended_footwear: Summer expeditions demand sturdy, enchanted walking boots; or perhaps lightweight, magically reinforced trainers; for optimal comfort and protection against the scorching sun.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no stiles on this walk. No fields with livestock on the route.
related_categories: Walks with a lighthouse or daymark

fields.title: West Pentire and Polly Joke
fields.description: A breathtaking vista of crimson poppies and sun-gold corn marigolds paints the June landscape;  Panoramic coastal views stretch from the ancient village of Crantock and the mystical headland of East Pentire to the legendary Trevose Head; Golden sands, kissed by the waves, lie spread at the enchanting Porth Joke and the shores of Crantock; The historic Bowgie Inn, a haven for weary travellers, stands proudly in Crantock.

fields.highlights: A breathtaking vista of crimson poppies and sun-gold corn marigolds paints the June landscape;  Panoramic coastal views stretch from the ancient village of Crantock and the mystical headland of East Pentire to the legendary Trevose Head; Golden sands, kissed by the waves, lie spread at the enchanting Porth Joke and the shores of Crantock; The historic Bowgie Inn, a haven for weary travellers, stands proudly in Crantock.
fields.points_of_interest: Carvings in Piper's Hole; West Pentire
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking shoes; For spring and autumn, consider enchanted leather boots offering ankle support and weather resistance; During summer's heat, opt for lightweight, breathable magical sandals crafted from shimmering mooncloth;  Winter expeditions demand reinforced, fur-lined boots imbued with warming enchantments;  Never underestimate the importance of proper footwear for your adventures.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Porth Joke, Crantock.



There are no stiles on this walk. Usually no livestock on the route. Dogs are not allowed inside the pub but are in the outside seating area.
related_categories: Walks least likely to have deep mud

fields.title: Porth Nanven to Nanquidno
fields.description: Ancient granite monoliths, at the mystical shores of Porth Nanven and Nanquidno, shaped by a prehistoric, titan-forged ocean; Breathtaking vistas across Whitsand Bay, to the legendary cove of Sennen and the mythical Land's End; Abundant wildlife, including the mystical choughs and the swift peregrine falcons.

fields.highlights: Ancient granite monoliths, at the mystical shores of Porth Nanven and Nanquidno, shaped by a prehistoric, titan-forged ocean; Breathtaking vistas across Whitsand Bay, to the legendary cove of Sennen and the mythical Land's End; Abundant wildlife, including the mystical choughs and the swift peregrine falcons.
fields.points_of_interest: Longships Lighthouse; The Brisons
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Nanquidno, Porth Nanven.



Stiles are all stone - effectively granite staircases - that most dogs are likely to be able to negotiate.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware the Wild Hounds!
Coastal Beaches welcoming four-legged friends year-round:  Nanquidno, a haven of sun-kissed sands; Porth Nanven, where the sea whispers ancient tales.


Stone stairways, forged from granite's might, are suitable for most faithful companions; yet, watch for treacherous steps.
Dire Warnings:
-  Heed the safety of your loyal hound;
-  Observe all decrees and restrictions;
-  Treat your faithful companion with honor and care.

fields.title: Daymer Bay to Padstow
fields.description: Golden sands stretching from the ancient Rock to the mystical Daymer Bay; St Enodoc Church, hallowed ground and final resting place of the legendary Sir John Betjeman; Panoramic vistas across the shimmering Camel Estuary, viewed from the heights of Tregirls; Pristine sands at Harbour Cove and St George's Cove, inviting exploration; Padstow's historic harbour, a haven for weathered vessels; Delectable local fare, savouring Padstow's culinary bounty; Wildflower-strewn dunes, a tapestry of nature's artistry

fields.highlights: Golden sands stretching from the ancient Rock to the mystical Daymer Bay; St Enodoc Church, hallowed ground and final resting place of the legendary Sir John Betjeman; Panoramic vistas across the shimmering Camel Estuary, viewed from the heights of Tregirls; Pristine sands at Harbour Cove and St George's Cove, inviting exploration; Padstow's historic harbour, a haven for weathered vessels; Delectable local fare, savouring Padstow's culinary bounty; Wildflower-strewn dunes, a tapestry of nature's artistry
fields.points_of_interest: The Doom Bar; Gun Point; National Lobster Hatchery; St Petroc's Church; Padstow Quays; Prideaux Place; St Enodoc Church; Stepper Point Daymark; Trebetherick Point Slate Formations
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for summer trails; waterproof wellies, magically reinforced against winter's relentless downpour
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Daymer Bay, Harbour Cove, Rock.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: St George's Cove.


There is only 1 stile on this walk and it is beside a gate.

fields.title: Port Isaac to St Kew
fields.description: The ancient fishing village and mystical harbours of Port Isaac and Port Gaverne; Breathtaking vistas across the enchanted Amble Valley; A carpet of wildflowers blooming along the mystical paths and lanes each spring; Legendary pubs awaiting your visit in Pendoggett and St Kew; A tempting array of restaurants, cafés, and traditional pubs in Port Isaac to conclude your journey

fields.highlights: The ancient fishing village and mystical harbours of Port Isaac and Port Gaverne; Breathtaking vistas across the enchanted Amble Valley; A carpet of wildflowers blooming along the mystical paths and lanes each spring; Legendary pubs awaiting your visit in Pendoggett and St Kew; A tempting array of restaurants, cafés, and traditional pubs in Port Isaac to conclude your journey
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy leather walking boots, enchanted for surefootedness on all terrains;  Waterproof magical boots, imbued with frost resistance, essential for winter expeditions.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Port Isaac, Port Gaverne.



Some of the stiles on the footpath are wired-over and missing footboards so dogs would need lifting over.  Height is around 3ft. The route passes through a farmyard with sheepdogs.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware the Canine Companions!
Beaches welcoming four-legged friends year-round: Port Isaac, a haven of salty breezes; Port Gaverne, where sandy shores meet playful paws.


Certain ancient stone pathways present challenges; some steps are treacherous, lacking sturdy footing, requiring your faithful companions to be lifted over obstacles of approximately three feet.  The trail winds through a farmyard guarded by watchful sheepdogs.
Rules:
- Ensure the safety of all creatures, great and small.
- Adhere to all posted warnings and restrictions.
- For the safe passage of your faithful companions, heed these warnings.

fields.title: Holywell Bay to Newquay (via bus)
fields.description: The Well of Aethelred - an ancient, mystical series of pools formed by the tears of stone giants; A breathtaking tapestry of crimson poppies and sun-gold marigolds blankets the land in June; Panoramic vistas of the craggy, legendary coastline unfold from the cliff path, revealing the mighty Crantock Chasm; Golden sands stretch invitingly at Holywell Bay, Porth Joke, and Crantock beaches; Diverse wildlife thrives along the shores and upon the windswept dunes of Cubert Common; The legendary Bowgie Inn, steeped in history, stands proudly in Crantock; A myriad of feathered creatures grace the Gannel estuary.

fields.highlights: The Well of Aethelred - an ancient, mystical series of pools formed by the tears of stone giants; A breathtaking tapestry of crimson poppies and sun-gold marigolds blankets the land in June; Panoramic vistas of the craggy, legendary coastline unfold from the cliff path, revealing the mighty Crantock Chasm; Golden sands stretch invitingly at Holywell Bay, Porth Joke, and Crantock beaches; Diverse wildlife thrives along the shores and upon the windswept dunes of Cubert Common; The legendary Bowgie Inn, steeped in history, stands proudly in Crantock; A myriad of feathered creatures grace the Gannel estuary.
fields.points_of_interest: Holywell Cave; Shipwreck on Holywell Beach; Ramparts on Kelsey Head; Carvings in Piper's Hole; Trenance Gardens; Trenance Heritage Cottages; West Pentire
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted Boots of the Deep Treeline; Suitable for all seasons; provide superior protection from mud and swamp; ideal for traversing bogs and rivers; essential magical footwear for the intrepid adventurer.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Holywell Bay, Porth Joke, Crantock.



There are no stiles on this walk.

fields.title: Carn Brea and the Great Flat Lode
fields.description: Breathtaking panoramic views from the mystical Carn Brea peak; exploration of the legendary King Edward Mine museum; a wealth of ancient mining heritage

fields.walk_name: Carn Brea and the Great Flat Lode
fields.highlights: Breathtaking panoramic views from the mystical Carn Brea peak; exploration of the legendary King Edward Mine museum; a wealth of ancient mining heritage
fields.points_of_interest: Basset Tramway; Basset United Mines; Carn Brea Castle; Great Condurrow Mine; King Edward Mine; King Edward Mine Museum; South Wheal Frances; St Euny Church; Wheal Basset; Wheal Grenville
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Hiking Boots;  For spring and autumn, consider enchanted leather boots, offering reliable ankle support and weather resistance;  In summer, opt for lighter magical sandals, woven with sun-resistant threads;  Winter demands the warmth of fur-lined, frost-resistant boots, imbued with minor frost-warding enchantments;  Always ensure your footwear provides adequate traction on varied terrain.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no stiles on this walk.

fields.title: Gunwalloe Coves
fields.description: The Loe Bar - a mystical barrier, home to sprites and elusive creatures; Cornwall's largest, ancient freshwater lake, shimmering under the fae light; Sandy beaches at Fishing Cove and Church Cove, kissed by the seafoam; Buried treasure, rumored to be guarded by a slumbering dragon, lies at Dollar Cove; Panoramic views of Mount's Bay unfold from Halzephron Cliff, a vantage point for ages past;  A humble eatery, offering sustenance to weary travelers, operates at Dollar Cove during the summer months (opening times available upon inquiry).

fields.highlights: The Loe Bar - a mystical barrier, home to sprites and elusive creatures; Cornwall's largest, ancient freshwater lake, shimmering under the fae light; Sandy beaches at Fishing Cove and Church Cove, kissed by the seafoam; Buried treasure, rumored to be guarded by a slumbering dragon, lies at Dollar Cove; Panoramic views of Mount's Bay unfold from Halzephron Cliff, a vantage point for ages past;  A humble eatery, offering sustenance to weary travelers, operates at Dollar Cove during the summer months (opening times available upon inquiry).
fields.points_of_interest: Gunwalloe Church; Halzephron Cliff; Loe Bar
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Gunwalloe Fishing Cove, Dollar Cove, Loe Bar.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Gunwalloe Church Cove.


Stiles reported as OK for large dogs.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Dire Beasts
Coastal Havens where four-legged allies are welcomed throughout the year: Gunwalloe Fishing Cove, a secluded inlet; Dollar Cove, a haven of shimmering sands; Loe Bar, where the wild waves crash upon the shore.
Coastal Havens with seasonal restrictions upon your loyal companions: Gunwalloe Church Cove, a place of ancient power.


Stiles proven passable for even the mightiest of hounds.
Dire Warnings:
- Ensure the safety of your faithful companions remains paramount;
- Adhere to all decrees and edicts concerning access;
- Remember, the wilds are unforgiving, and vigilance is your greatest ally.

fields.title: Lesnewth to Tresparrett in the Valency Valley
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical Valency Valley, a land steeped in ancient magic; Serene woodland trails alongside the whispering River Valency, home to sprites and unseen creatures;  Ancient churchyard at Lesnewth, a hallowed ground dating back to the legendary Celtic era;  Sample hearty fare and potent ales at the Horseshoe Inn in Tresparrett, a tavern favored by weary travelers and merry adventurers;  St Juliot Church, a place of worship lovingly restored by the celebrated wordsmith, Thomas Hardy.

fields.walk_name: Lesnewth to Tresparrett in the Valency Valley
fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical Valency Valley, a land steeped in ancient magic; Serene woodland trails alongside the whispering River Valency, home to sprites and unseen creatures;  Ancient churchyard at Lesnewth, a hallowed ground dating back to the legendary Celtic era;  Sample hearty fare and potent ales at the Horseshoe Inn in Tresparrett, a tavern favored by weary travelers and merry adventurers;  St Juliot Church, a place of worship lovingly restored by the celebrated wordsmith, Thomas Hardy.
fields.points_of_interest: Lesnewth Church; St Juliot Church
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots;  For summer treks, consider enchanted leather boots, offering breathability and protection from thorns;  In winter,  magical thermal boots are essential, imbued with warmth against frost and snow;  For swampy terrain, water-resistant boots are a must, perhaps enchanted with a charm against mire and muck;  Always ensure your footwear fits snugly, preventing blisters and ensuring secure footing on treacherous paths.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsFields on the route are used for grazing cattle.  There are free-range chickens at Trevilla. A few of the stiles on this walk are awkward for dogs, including a 6ft ladder stile.  Some lifting is likely to be required which may not be practical with large dogs.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware!  The verdant pastures of Dogs Fields, though seemingly idyllic, are trod by mighty horned beasts; free-range fowl roam wild at Trevilla, their sharp beaks a potential hazard; several treacherous stile crossings await, including a fearsome six-foot ladder stile that may challenge even the most agile of faithful companions;  lifting of your loyal hound may be required on the path, a considerable burden for owners of larger breeds.

fields.title: Bossiney, St Nectan's Glen and Rocky Valley
fields.description: A mystical woodland path winds through the enchanted St Nectan's Glen;  Behold the shimmering cascade of St Nectan's Kieve, a breathtaking waterfall (small entrance fee required); Refreshments and facilities are available at St Nectan's Glen, accessible without needing to pay for waterfall access;  Explore the labyrinthine stone carvings hidden within the ancient, whispering woods of Rocky Valley;  Marvel at spectacular coastal panoramas stretching across the legendary Willapark headland and Darvis's Point; Discover secluded, sandy havens at Benoath Cove and Bossiney Haven.

fields.walk_name: Bossiney, St Nectan's Glen and Rocky Valley
fields.highlights: A mystical woodland path winds through the enchanted St Nectan's Glen;  Behold the shimmering cascade of St Nectan's Kieve, a breathtaking waterfall (small entrance fee required); Refreshments and facilities are available at St Nectan's Glen, accessible without needing to pay for waterfall access;  Explore the labyrinthine stone carvings hidden within the ancient, whispering woods of Rocky Valley;  Marvel at spectacular coastal panoramas stretching across the legendary Willapark headland and Darvis's Point; Discover secluded, sandy havens at Benoath Cove and Bossiney Haven.
fields.points_of_interest: Lye Rock; Rocky Valley; Carvings in Rocky Valley; St Nectan's Glen; St Piran's Chapel; St Piran's Well
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  For the Spring and Autumn months, enchanted leather boots offer reliable protection against mud and shifting terrain; whilst in Summer, breathable elven sandals, imbued with a minor earth warding, will keep your feet cool and dry;  During the harshest Winter months, however, only the thickest frost-resistant boots, magically reinforced with dwarven steel, will suffice.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Bossiney Haven.



Small or less confident dogs may struggle with the stile over the wall at direction 5.  There is a gateway joining the same 2 fields roughly 50 metres to the right.

fields.title: Wheal Maid and Poldice Valley
fields.description: The Ancient Mines of Eldoria; A mystical landscape of shimmering, unearthly minerals

fields.highlights: The Ancient Mines of Eldoria; A mystical landscape of shimmering, unearthly minerals
fields.points_of_interest: Consolidated Mines; John Taylor's Engine House; John Taylor's Tramway; Poldice Mine; The Clock Tower; Wheal Maid; Wheal Maid Tailings Dam
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Hiking Boots: For Spring and Autumn;  Enchanted Leather Boots, providing superior ankle support and weather resistance; ideal for traversing varied terrain.  Winter Treks:  Frost-resistant Magical Footwear, imbued with runes of warmth and enhanced traction; essential for snowy peaks and icy paths. Summer Expeditions:  Lightweight, enchanted sandals; crafted from supple, sun-baked hide; offering breathability without sacrificing protection from thorns and sharp stones.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no stiles on this walk. The route doesn't cross fields so livestock are very unlikely. Water in the Wheal Maid lagoons contains high levels of arsenic so keep dogs under close supervision here.

fields.title: Perranporth to St Agnes (via bus)

fields.recommended_footwear:
**Footwear Requirements:**

* **Summer:**  Lightweight, enchanted leather boots; breathable; provide ankle support; suitable for traversing overgrown paths; resist minor thorns and brambles.
* **Autumn:** Sturdy, water-resistant magical footwear; reinforced soles for muddy trails; ankle-high for protection against dampness; offer warmth without restricting movement.
* **Winter:**  Thick, fur-lined boots; enchanted for warmth against frost and snow;  non-slip soles for icy terrain; provide excellent ankle support for snowy climbs; magical protection against frostbite.
* **Spring:** Durable, enchanted leather boots; offer protection from mud and puddles; lightweight enough for long days of travel; flexible and comfortable for varied terrain.

fields.title: Polperro to Lansallos
fields.description: Gazes upon the mystical Polperro Harbour and its ancient, craggy coastline; Plunge into the enchanted tidal pool, a shimmering sapphire on calm summer days;  Soar above the quaint village, taking in breathtaking bird's-eye views from the heights; Discover the sands of Lansallos Cove, a legendary beach kissed by the waves; Drink in panoramic vistas across the mystical Lantivet Bay, its waters shimmering like a dragon's hoard; Wander the pretty, wooded path through West Coombe, an ancient track winding from Lansallos to the sea's edge.

fields.highlights: Gazes upon the mystical Polperro Harbour and its ancient, craggy coastline; Plunge into the enchanted tidal pool, a shimmering sapphire on calm summer days;  Soar above the quaint village, taking in breathtaking bird's-eye views from the heights; Discover the sands of Lansallos Cove, a legendary beach kissed by the waves; Drink in panoramic vistas across the mystical Lantivet Bay, its waters shimmering like a dragon's hoard; Wander the pretty, wooded path through West Coombe, an ancient track winding from Lansallos to the sea's edge.
fields.points_of_interest: Chapel Pool; Lansallos Church; Polperro Mediaeval Chapel and Holy Well; Wesleyan Chapel; Polperro Net Loft; Willy Wilcox Cave
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Lansallos Cove.



There are no stiles on this walk. No fields with livestock on the route.

fields.title: Pendeen to Portheras Cove
fields.description: The ancient, clanking heart of the Levant Mine's legendary steam engine, still beating strong; the mystical sands of Portheras Cove, stretching to the waves' embrace; the shadowed depths of Geevor Mine, a place of ancient secrets and forgotten lore.

fields.highlights: The ancient, clanking heart of the Levant Mine's legendary steam engine, still beating strong; the mystical sands of Portheras Cove, stretching to the waves' embrace; the shadowed depths of Geevor Mine, a place of ancient secrets and forgotten lore.
fields.points_of_interest: Pools on The Averack; Geevor Tin Mine; Levant Mine; Pendeen Church; Pendeen Lighthouse
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy, enchanted leather boots for the warmer months;  weatherproof, magical wellies imbued with frost resistance for winter expeditions.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Portheras Cove.



Small-medium dogs may be able to fit through gaps in many of the stone stiles but very large dogs are likely to need a little help over a couple.  There is an electric fence running alongside the boggy track after Portheras Cove to contain the ponies - large dogs need keeping away from this.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beasts of Burden
Coastal Zones welcoming four-legged allies throughout the year: Portheras Cove.


Lesser companions may navigate the fissures in the ancient stone barriers; however, mightier hounds may require assistance surmounting certain obstacles.  A shimmering ward, woven to restrain the bog ponies beyond Portheras Cove, presents a peril to larger creatures; ensure your loyal friend remains at a safe distance.
Directives:
- Preserve the well-being of all creatures.
- Adhere to all limitations and stipulations.
- When speaking of canine allies, refer to them as 'faithful companions'.
- Maintain the original structure and formatting
related_categories: Walks with a lighthouse or daymark

fields.title: Cubert to St Piran's Round
fields.description: The mystical Penhale Sands, a Site of Special Scientific Interest, ablaze with cowslips in the month of May; St Piran's Round, an ancient, legendary amphitheatre echoing with forgotten tales;  Wildflowers paint the spring footpaths in vibrant hues; Abundant wildlife, including birdsong and fluttering butterflies, fill the air.

fields.highlights: The mystical Penhale Sands, a Site of Special Scientific Interest, ablaze with cowslips in the month of May; St Piran's Round, an ancient, legendary amphitheatre echoing with forgotten tales;  Wildflowers paint the spring footpaths in vibrant hues; Abundant wildlife, including birdsong and fluttering butterflies, fill the air.
fields.points_of_interest: Cubert Church; Mount Mine; Penhale Sands; Perran Round
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and rough terrain;  when prolonged downpours transform the land to mire, swap to waterproof, magically reinforced wellies.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are 3 stiles on the route which most dogs are likely to be able to negotiate.

fields.title: Bodmin and Bodiniel - the two manors
fields.description: Truro, Cornwall's ancient county seat; The Town Museum, free entry for all; The legendary Cornwall Regimental Museum, showcasing valor and history; Experience the mystical courtroom of the Shire Hall; Bodmin Beacon, a nature reserve of breathtaking vistas; Scarlett's Well, a spring of whispered legend; Witness the mystical dance of snowdrops, bluebells, and woodland creatures at Bodiniel; Explore Bodmin’s historic jail, a place of shadows and secrets; Journey aboard the Bodmin & Wenford heritage railway, a steam train through time.

fields.walk_name: Bodmin and Bodiniel - the two manors
fields.highlights: Truro, Cornwall's ancient county seat; The Town Museum, free entry for all; The legendary Cornwall Regimental Museum, showcasing valor and history; Experience the mystical courtroom of the Shire Hall; Bodmin Beacon, a nature reserve of breathtaking vistas; Scarlett's Well, a spring of whispered legend; Witness the mystical dance of snowdrops, bluebells, and woodland creatures at Bodiniel; Explore Bodmin’s historic jail, a place of shadows and secrets; Journey aboard the Bodmin & Wenford heritage railway, a steam train through time.
fields.points_of_interest: Berrycoombe Cross; Bodmin Beacon; Bodmin Beacon Nature Reserve; St Thomas Becket's Chapel; Bible Christian Chapel; St Petroc's Church; Eye Well; Bodmin Jail; Bodmin General Station; Bodmin Town Museum; Shire Hall; Bodmin-Wenford Railway; Cock's Well; Celtic Cross; Gilbert Monument; Cornwall's Regimental Museum; Scarlett's Well; St Guron's Well
fields.recommended_footwear: Lightweight, enchanted walking shoes for summer expeditions; sturdy, enchanted leather boots for winter's harsh conditions.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere is only one stile on the route but it is over a slatted fence so dogs will need lifting.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Nare Head to Portloe
fields.description: Breathtaking panoramic views from the legendary Nare Head; A restored Cold War nuclear bunker, now a mystical vault of forgotten technology; The unspoilt fishing village of Portloe, nestled in a hidden cove; Abundant coastal wildlife, including ancient avian creatures and rare reptilian beasts.

fields.highlights: Breathtaking panoramic views from the legendary Nare Head; A restored Cold War nuclear bunker, now a mystical vault of forgotten technology; The unspoilt fishing village of Portloe, nestled in a hidden cove; Abundant coastal wildlife, including ancient avian creatures and rare reptilian beasts.
fields.points_of_interest: Mallet's Cottage; Nare Head; Veryan Cold War Bunker
fields.trail_considerations: DogsDogs will require lifting over several of the stiles.  Owners of heavy dogs note that some of these are high, requiring a dog to be lifted above chest height.  One also has a steep drop of around 6ft on the far side.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware, Travelers with Faithful Companions!
Your loyal steeds will require hoisting over numerous ancient stone stiles;  Keepers of mighty hounds should be warned that some are of considerable height, demanding a lift exceeding your own breastplate; One stile in particular presents a perilous drop of some six feet onto jagged rocks beyond.

fields.title: St Breward to Lank
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical countryside surrounding Churchtown; St Breward's ancient church, the loftiest spire in all of Cornwall; Discover Lamphill Woods, a realm of ancient woodland and home to rare, shimmering butterflies;  Savor local fare and legendary ales at the historic Old Inn in St Breward; Wander through picturesque woods and along the whispering banks of the Camel valley.

fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical countryside surrounding Churchtown; St Breward's ancient church, the loftiest spire in all of Cornwall; Discover Lamphill Woods, a realm of ancient woodland and home to rare, shimmering butterflies;  Savor local fare and legendary ales at the historic Old Inn in St Breward; Wander through picturesque woods and along the whispering banks of the Camel valley.
fields.points_of_interest: Lamphill Woods; St Breward Church; Holy Well of St James
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots;  For summer, opt for lightweight, enchanted leather boots offering breathability;  In winter, choose robust, frost-resistant magical footwear with thick, fleece-lined soles for warmth and sure footing on icy paths;  Always ensure your boots are well-maintained, using enchanted leather balm to prevent damage and ensure longevity.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsStone stiles reported as OK for enthusiastic dogs.  Large dogs may need help over one.  Less athletic dogs may also need lifting over some of the others. The route passes briefly through a deer enclosure and beside animal pens for childrens' petting (e.g. young goats).
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware! Stone stiles, though passable for enthusiastic companions, present a challenge; larger hounds may require assistance over one particularly stubborn stile;  less agile companions may need lifting over several; the path briefly traverses a sacred grove of the swift-footed forest folk and skirts enclosures of gentle, yet potentially mischievous, children's familiars (e.g., the bleating young of the Capricorn).
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Rough Tor and Brown Willy
fields.description: Rough Tor - the most formidable and legendary tor upon the mystical Bodmin Moor;  A summit of weather-beaten granite, sculpted by the ages atop Showery Tor;  Commanding spectacular panoramic vistas from the heights of Rough Tor and the ancient Brown Willy;  Scattered cairns, mystical stone circles, and other vestiges of an ancient Neolithic civilization; Brown Willy - Cornwall's loftiest peak, shrouded in myth;  Bronze Age hut circles, ancient field systems, and enigmatic enclosures.

fields.highlights: Rough Tor - the most formidable and legendary tor upon the mystical Bodmin Moor;  A summit of weather-beaten granite, sculpted by the ages atop Showery Tor;  Commanding spectacular panoramic vistas from the heights of Rough Tor and the ancient Brown Willy;  Scattered cairns, mystical stone circles, and other vestiges of an ancient Neolithic civilization; Brown Willy - Cornwall's loftiest peak, shrouded in myth;  Bronze Age hut circles, ancient field systems, and enigmatic enclosures.
fields.points_of_interest: Brown Willy; Summit Cairns on Brown Willy; Fernacre Stone Circle; Roughtor; Roughtor Holy Well; Showery Tor; Stannon Lake
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for marsh-walking even in summer;  their soles imbued with protective wards against bog-treads and mire; essential magical footwear for all seasons.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are 2 stiles on the ascent to Brown Willy.  The first is easier for dogs and beside a gate.  The one higher up is wired-over and dogs will need lifting over to reach the summit. Sheep and ponies are grazed on the open moor. Dogs on leads no more than 2m long between 1 March and 31 July (breeding period for ground-nesting birds).
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware, Travelers with Faithful Companions!Two stile-like pathways ascend towards the peak of Brown Willy; the lower, gentler passage is more suitable for your four-legged friends and lies beside an ancient gate; the higher stile, however, is ensnared in thorny, magical wires, requiring your faithful companion to be lifted to reach the summit.  Beware the wild sheep and ponies that graze the mystical moorlands;  keep your loyal companions on leads no longer than two paces between the first day of the Verdant Bloom and the last day of the Sun's Embrace (to protect the nests of ground-dwelling creatures).

fields.title: The Lizard and Kynance Cove
fields.description: Scalebeard's Pinnacle - the southernmost extremity of Albion's mystical isle; The ancient stone spire of Lizard's Beacon, piercing the mists; Kynance Cove's sands, a shimmering expanse of pearly grain; Serpentine stones, sculpted by the tireless ocean's hand, their surfaces polished to a mystical gleam;  A vibrant tapestry of wildflowers, including the legendary Cornish heath, adorning the cliffs.

fields.highlights: Scalebeard's Pinnacle - the southernmost extremity of Albion's mystical isle; The ancient stone spire of Lizard's Beacon, piercing the mists; Kynance Cove's sands, a shimmering expanse of pearly grain; Serpentine stones, sculpted by the tireless ocean's hand, their surfaces polished to a mystical gleam;  A vibrant tapestry of wildflowers, including the legendary Cornish heath, adorning the cliffs.
fields.points_of_interest: The Devil's Bellows; Lizard Foghorns; Lizard Lighthouse; The Lizard NNR; Lizard Point
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Polpeor Cove.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Kynance Cove.


Stiles reported as OK for large dogs.
related_categories: Walks with a lighthouse or daymark

fields.title: Kilkhampton to the Coombe valley
fields.description: The hallowed halls of Kilkhampton's ancient church, adorned with mystical stained glass and intricate, legendary carvings; Kilkhampton Common, a mystical nature reserve teeming with arcane flora and fauna;  wildlife abounds in and around the enchanted Stowe Woods, home to creatures both wondrous and strange; the crumbling yet majestic remains of Penstowe Castle, a testament to a bygone era.

fields.highlights: The hallowed halls of Kilkhampton's ancient church, adorned with mystical stained glass and intricate, legendary carvings; Kilkhampton Common, a mystical nature reserve teeming with arcane flora and fauna;  wildlife abounds in and around the enchanted Stowe Woods, home to creatures both wondrous and strange; the crumbling yet majestic remains of Penstowe Castle, a testament to a bygone era.
fields.points_of_interest: Coombe Valley; Kilkhampton Church; Kilkhampton Common; Penstowe castle
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  Enchanted Boots of the Trail for Spring & Autumn hikes;  Magical Winter Boots, imbued with frost-resistance, for snowy expeditions;  Lightweight Summer Sandals, enchanted for swift travel across sun-baked plains.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no stiles on the route.

fields.title: Falmouth and Pendennis Point
fields.description: The ancient port of Falmouth, a haven for seafarers since time immemorial; Pendennis Castle, a legendary fortress overlooking the mystical waters, and Little Dennis Blockhouse, its stalwart companion; Gyllynvase and Swanpool beaches, stretches of golden sand kissed by the waves of the mystical sea; Swanpool nature reserve, a haven of peace and tranquility, teeming with enchanted creatures.

fields.highlights: The ancient port of Falmouth, a haven for seafarers since time immemorial; Pendennis Castle, a legendary fortress overlooking the mystical waters, and Little Dennis Blockhouse, its stalwart companion; Gyllynvase and Swanpool beaches, stretches of golden sand kissed by the waves of the mystical sea; Swanpool nature reserve, a haven of peace and tranquility, teeming with enchanted creatures.
fields.points_of_interest: Carrick Roads; Crab Quay Battery; Falmouth Parish Church; Falmouth Docks; Falmouth Harbour; Killigrew Monument; Little Dennis Blockhouse; National Maritime Museum; Pendennis Castle; Queen Mary Gardens; St Anthony's Lighthouse; Swanpool
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Swanpool, Castle Beach, Gyllyngvase.


There are no stiles on this walk. No livestock on the route.
related_categories: Walks least likely to have deep mud

fields.title: St Mawgan to St Columb Major
fields.description: A mystical, broadleaf woodland, whispering secrets along the silver River Menalhyl; The legendary mediaeval market town of St Columb Major, its ancient stones echoing with tales of ages past; Sun-drenched meadows, teeming with fantastical wildflowers and creatures of myth along the Vale of Lanherne; The tranquil riverside village of St Mawgan, nestled beside the river, home to an ancient church and a convent shrouded in legend; The ancient and thrilling sport of Cornish Hurling, played with fierce passion in St Columb.

fields.walk_name: St Mawgan to St Columb Major
fields.highlights: A mystical, broadleaf woodland, whispering secrets along the silver River Menalhyl; The legendary mediaeval market town of St Columb Major, its ancient stones echoing with tales of ages past; Sun-drenched meadows, teeming with fantastical wildflowers and creatures of myth along the Vale of Lanherne; The tranquil riverside village of St Mawgan, nestled beside the river, home to an ancient church and a convent shrouded in legend; The ancient and thrilling sport of Cornish Hurling, played with fierce passion in St Columb.
fields.points_of_interest: Lanherne Convent; St Columb Major Church; St Mawgan Church
fields.trail_considerations: DogsLarger dogs may need lifting over a couple of the stiles. The walk passes through a pheasant breeding area.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware; Mighty hounds of considerable stature may require Herculean effort to traverse certain obstacles; The path ventures near sacred pheasant grounds, tread carefully lest ye anger the avian deities.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Portheras Cove and Chûn Quoit
fields.description: The pristine sands of Portheras Cove, a beach of shimmering white; Breathtaking coastal vistas showcasing the legendary Pendeen lighthouse;  Ancient Chûn Quoit and the mystical ruins of Chûn Castle stand sentinel.

fields.highlights: The pristine sands of Portheras Cove, a beach of shimmering white; Breathtaking coastal vistas showcasing the legendary Pendeen lighthouse;  Ancient Chûn Quoit and the mystical ruins of Chûn Castle stand sentinel.
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots; essential for all adventurers.  Waterproof, enchanted boots are required during the harsh winter months; to prevent frostbite and the chilling effects of wicked sprites.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Portheras Cove.



There are 3 stone stiles on the route - these resemble staircases which most dogs should be able to negotiate. There are 2 fields on the route which may be used for grazing.  It's possible to bypass these by staying on the track until it ends on the road and walking on the road instead to rejoin the route. A stretch of coast path on the route is sometimes grazed with horses.

fields.title: Barrett's Zawn and Dannonchapel
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas from the windswept precipice overlooking Barrett's Zawn, a beach of legend; The mystical "Donkey Hole," a hidden passage leading to Barrett's Zawn (entry strongly discouraged); The eerie, ancient ruins of Dannonchapel, a hamlet steeped in mystery and a thousand years of secrets; Panoramic views of the majestic Port Isaac Bay, unfolding from the coastal trail, a path walked by heroes and villains alike; Majestic birds of prey circling the deep, shadowy gorge at Dannonchapel, their cries echoing through the ages; Picturesque country lanes and tracks, ablaze with wildflowers during the spring and summer months

fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas from the windswept precipice overlooking Barrett's Zawn, a beach of legend; The mystical "Donkey Hole," a hidden passage leading to Barrett's Zawn (entry strongly discouraged); The eerie, ancient ruins of Dannonchapel, a hamlet steeped in mystery and a thousand years of secrets; Panoramic views of the majestic Port Isaac Bay, unfolding from the coastal trail, a path walked by heroes and villains alike; Majestic birds of prey circling the deep, shadowy gorge at Dannonchapel, their cries echoing through the ages; Picturesque country lanes and tracks, ablaze with wildflowers during the spring and summer months
fields.points_of_interest: Dannonchapel Quarry
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  For the spring and autumn months, consider enchanted leather boots, offering superior protection against mud and shifting earth;  During the harshest winter,  magical thermal boots are essential;  Lightweight, enchanted walking shoes are suitable for summer hikes;  All footwear should provide excellent ankle support.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThe stile just before you descend into the valley at Dannonchapel is wired-over so dogs will need lifting over it.  Dogs may also need help over a couple of stiles after Lower Tynes.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware, Travelers with Faithful Companions!The ancient gateway before the descent into the valley of Dannonchapel is ensnared by wicked thorns; your faithful companions will require assistance to surmount this obstacle.  Further trials await; your loyal friends may also need aid in traversing a pair of treacherous stone steps beyond Lower Tynes.

fields.title: Helston and Cober Valley
fields.description: The mystical Greenwood bordering the whispering River Cober; the ancient and legendary town of Helston

fields.highlights: The mystical Greenwood bordering the whispering River Cober; the ancient and legendary town of Helston
fields.points_of_interest: Grylls Monument; Helston Parish Church
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy enchanted boots, ideal for most journeys; swap for lighter walking shoes crafted from enchanted leather in prolonged dry spells;  upon encountering torrential downpours, don your waterproof wellies imbued with protective runes.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsDogs need to be sufficiently agile and confident to negotiate the stepping stones across the river.  Carrying a wriggling dog across would not be easy. The only stiles are beside gates which can be opened to let dogs through.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware!  Faithful companions must possess the agility of a mountain goat and the courage of a griffon to traverse the treacherous river stones; carrying a struggling hound across the churning waters is a fool's errand; access for faithful companions is only available via ancient stiles adjacent to gates, which, with a hearty heave, may be opened.

fields.title: Mullion to Predannack
fields.description: Golden sands of the mystical Polurrian Cove; Panoramic vistas across the legendary Mount's Bay, encompassing the ancient city of Penzance and the mythical St Michael's Mount; Picturesque harbour nestled within the ancient Mullion Cove; A dramatic, ancient coastline of rugged cliffs and mystical isles along the formidable Mullion Cliff

fields.highlights: Golden sands of the mystical Polurrian Cove; Panoramic vistas across the legendary Mount's Bay, encompassing the ancient city of Penzance and the mythical St Michael's Mount; Picturesque harbour nestled within the ancient Mullion Cove; A dramatic, ancient coastline of rugged cliffs and mystical isles along the formidable Mullion Cliff
fields.points_of_interest: The Lizard NNR; Mullion Church; Mullion Island
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking shoes, ideal for spring and summer expeditions;  or, for winter's biting frost, a pair of enchanted boots, offering superior warmth and protection against treacherous terrain.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Polurrian Cove.


Athletic dogs are likely to be able to negotiate the stiles.  Less athletic dogs may need a helping hand here and there. Dogs need to be on leads around the harbour area of Mullion Cove.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Fearsome Beasts
Coastal regions with seasonal bans on four-legged friends: Polurrian Cove; a place where the very stones whisper of ancient curses upon the unwary canine.


Mighty hounds of great stamina may easily traverse the treacherous stile-paths;  Lesser beasts may require the aid of a strong arm and unwavering loyalty.  All creatures of canine origin must be held firmly by the leash near the perilous harbor of Mullion Cove; where the sea's wrath is ever present.
Rules:
- Ensure the safety of all travellers is paramount.
- Adhere strictly to all decrees and limitations.
- When referring to our loyal companions, always use the phrase 'faithful companions'.
- Preserve the original structure and arrangement.

fields.title: Rosemullion Head
fields.description: The enchanted Glendurgan Gardens, a place of ancient pathways and mystical blooms;  Undersea grottoes shimmering beneath the waves off legendary Rosemullion Head; A sheltered cove of silver sand at the mystical Maenporth beach;  Small, secluded beaches nestled along the mystical Helford River

fields.highlights: The enchanted Glendurgan Gardens, a place of ancient pathways and mystical blooms;  Undersea grottoes shimmering beneath the waves off legendary Rosemullion Head; A sheltered cove of silver sand at the mystical Maenporth beach;  Small, secluded beaches nestled along the mystical Helford River
fields.points_of_interest: Glendurgan Garden; Mawnan Church; Pendennis Castle
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy, enchanted boots, ideal for traversing the snow-laden peaks of winter; Lightweight, magical footwear, perfect for dry summer trails.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Porth Sawsen, Porthallack, Prisk Cove.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Maenporth.


Stiles reported as OK for dogs.

fields.title: St Ives to Carn Naun
fields.description: A jagged, ancient coastline stretches between the mystical villages of Zennor and St Ives;  From lofty cliffs, gaze upon breathtaking, panoramic views of St Ives, its legendary bay, and the sprawling coastline beyond; Bask on the sun-kissed sands of Porthgwidden, Porthmeor, and the enchanting shores surrounding Carrick Du; Explore St Ives' historic harbour, a charming maze of ancient buildings and cobbled streets; Discover the Tate Art Gallery and a plethora of mystical, hidden galleries showcasing the works of talented artisans.

fields.highlights: A jagged, ancient coastline stretches between the mystical villages of Zennor and St Ives;  From lofty cliffs, gaze upon breathtaking, panoramic views of St Ives, its legendary bay, and the sprawling coastline beyond; Bask on the sun-kissed sands of Porthgwidden, Porthmeor, and the enchanting shores surrounding Carrick Du; Explore St Ives' historic harbour, a charming maze of ancient buildings and cobbled streets; Discover the Tate Art Gallery and a plethora of mystical, hidden galleries showcasing the works of talented artisans.
fields.points_of_interest: Brea Consols; Hor Mine; Smeaton's Pier; Venton Ia
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and brambles; or, during the harshest winter months, substitute with waterproof magical wellies, imbued with frost-resistance.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: St Ives Harbour.


Athletic dogs should be able to negotiate most of the stiles but there is one with footholds over a wall where dogs are likely to need help.
related_categories: Walks with a lighthouse or daymark

fields.title: Porth Reservoir and Colan church
fields.description: A mystical woodland of ancient trees and sparkling lakes; Abundant wildlife such as soaring eagles, majestic deer, and cunning badgers roam freely; Crumbling, moss-covered ruins of the legendary manor houses of the Nanswhyden estate stand as silent sentinels; Panoramic views of the shimmering lake and verdant valley unfold from the sturdy Nanswhyden farm.

fields.highlights: A mystical woodland of ancient trees and sparkling lakes; Abundant wildlife such as soaring eagles, majestic deer, and cunning badgers roam freely; Crumbling, moss-covered ruins of the legendary manor houses of the Nanswhyden estate stand as silent sentinels; Panoramic views of the shimmering lake and verdant valley unfold from the sturdy Nanswhyden farm.
fields.points_of_interest: Colan Church
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted Boots of the Mirewalker; ideal for traversing swampy terrain and rainy seasons; their woven reeds repel water with potent enchantments; essential for adventurers braving the wetlands.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsDog ban: at Porth Reservoir all year (due to wildlife reserve). There currently isn't a dog-friendly alternative for this route as it's dependent on parking at Porth Reservoir.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware, Travelers! Canine Companions Forbidden:  Near the mystical Porth Reservoir, all seasons (to protect the sacred wildlife sanctuary).;  Alas, no suitable path exists for your faithful companions on this journey, as it relies on access to the Reservoir's enchanted parking grounds.

fields.title: St Nectan's Glen and Trevillett Valley
fields.description: A mystical woodland path winds through the ancient heart of St Nectan's Glen;  Behold the shimmering cascade of St Nectan's Kieve, a legendary waterfall (small fee for access); Refreshments and facilities are available at St Nectan's Glen, accessible without paying for waterfall entry;  From Trewinnick, drink in breathtaking panoramic vistas encompassing the legendary Tintagel and the mystical depths of St Nectan's Glen.

fields.walk_name: St Nectan's Glen and Trevillett Valley
fields.highlights: A mystical woodland path winds through the ancient heart of St Nectan's Glen;  Behold the shimmering cascade of St Nectan's Kieve, a legendary waterfall (small fee for access); Refreshments and facilities are available at St Nectan's Glen, accessible without paying for waterfall entry;  From Trewinnick, drink in breathtaking panoramic vistas encompassing the legendary Tintagel and the mystical depths of St Nectan's Glen.
fields.points_of_interest: Camelot Castle Hotel; Fenterleigh Cross; Lye Rock; St Nectan's Glen; Long and Short Island
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted boots, providing reliable protection from the elements;  Sturdy wellies, imbued with frost-resistance for the harshest winter journeys.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsSeveral stiles on the route are likely to be challenging for dogs.  Some lifting may be required. The café at St Nectan's Glen is dog-friendly.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware Ye Who Travel with Faithful Companions;Several stile crossings upon this path shall test even the mightiest of canine legs; some hoisting may be required to aid your four-legged friend across the treacherous gaps; The haven at St Nectan's Glen offers respite and warm welcome to all creatures, great and small.

fields.title: Truro to Roseworthy
fields.description: A tranquil stroll through the mystical Kenwyn Valley; a visit to the enchanted Penrose Water Gardens, overflowing with sprites and secrets; the awe-inspiring, ancient Victorian architecture of Truro, a testament to forgotten kings; vibrant, legendary gardens bursting with colour throughout the spring and summer months.

fields.highlights: A tranquil stroll through the mystical Kenwyn Valley; a visit to the enchanted Penrose Water Gardens, overflowing with sprites and secrets; the awe-inspiring, ancient Victorian architecture of Truro, a testament to forgotten kings; vibrant, legendary gardens bursting with colour throughout the spring and summer months.
fields.points_of_interest: Penrose Water Gardens; Truro Cathedral; Victoria Gardens
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking shoes;  For warmer months, opt for lightweight, enchanted leather boots offering superior breathability; during the colder seasons, choose sturdy, magical footwear crafted from frost-resistant hides, lined with thick, fleece-like linings for exceptional warmth;  When traversing treacherous terrain, consider reinforced climbing boots imbued with earth magic for superior grip and stability.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsStiles should be navigable or bypassable by dogs so lifting shouldn't be necessary.

fields.title: Deerpark to Herodsfoot
fields.description: An enchanted woodland brimming with mystical bluebells in the springtime; Offering respite from the scorching summer sun beneath the ancient boughs;  The trails may be split into separate 2.1 and 3-mile circular walks.

fields.highlights: An enchanted woodland brimming with mystical bluebells in the springtime; Offering respite from the scorching summer sun beneath the ancient boughs;  The trails may be split into separate 2.1 and 3-mile circular walks.
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy enchanted boots, ideal for traversing rugged terrain; or, for warmer months, lightweight magical footwear suitable for summer trails.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are only 2 stiles on the route - one has a dog gate and the other a large gap alongside. One small paddock is sometimes used to graze sheep.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: St Dominic to Cotehele Bridge
fields.description: Ancient, sprawling woodland of broadleaf and towering conifer; Realm of strange and mystical fungi, a spectacle to behold; Cotehele Mill, a brief detour through time; Cotehele Quay, a short diversion along the river's edge; Refreshments available at the legendary NT café on Cotehele Quay, welcoming all, regardless of membership.

fields.highlights: Ancient, sprawling woodland of broadleaf and towering conifer; Realm of strange and mystical fungi, a spectacle to behold; Cotehele Mill, a brief detour through time; Cotehele Quay, a short diversion along the river's edge; Refreshments available at the legendary NT café on Cotehele Quay, welcoming all, regardless of membership.
fields.points_of_interest: Lime Kilns at Cotehele and Calstock; Cotehele Mill; Cotehele Weir and Mill Leat
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  For the Spring & Autumn months, choose enchanted leather boots, reinforced with dwarven steel plating; Summer calls for lighter, magically cooled sandals, woven from willow and treated with sunstone dust;  Winter necessitates frost-resistant boots, lined with thick furs and imbued with warming runes; Avoid flimsy footwear, such as cloth slippers, as they offer little protection on the trail.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are 3 wooden stiles on the route which are all wired-over. The third one has a gate alongside.  The first two have fences alongside with gaps that small-medium dogs may be able to pass through with help (the second one has a barbed wire fence). There are only 2 fields on the route where livestock is a possibility.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware Ye Who Travel with Faithful Companions!Three perilous wooden stiles, each guarded by wicked, interwoven wires, bar your path; the third stile is flanked by a treacherous gate. The first two are accompanied by fences riddled with gaps, through which small to medium-sized companions may slip with cunning assistance (the second fence is further protected by barbed wire, a cruel guardian's sting). Only two fields lie ahead, where monstrous beasts may graze, presenting a threat to the unwary.
Rules:
- Heed all warnings lest ye suffer mishap.
- Observe all restrictions and demands, for your safety and the safety of your loyal friends.
- Speak of your faithful companions as such.
- Maintain the order and structure of this ancient prophecy.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Caerhays Castle to Hemmick Beach
fields.description: The ancient stone citadel of Caerhays, and its mystical, sprawling gardens; Breathtaking vistas of Caerhays Castle, revealed from the winding, moss-covered footpaths; Panoramic views along the legendary coastline of Veryan Bay, stretching to the horizon; Pristine, sandy beaches at the hidden coves of Porthluney and Hemmick.

fields.highlights: The ancient stone citadel of Caerhays, and its mystical, sprawling gardens; Breathtaking vistas of Caerhays Castle, revealed from the winding, moss-covered footpaths; Panoramic views along the legendary coastline of Veryan Bay, stretching to the horizon; Pristine, sandy beaches at the hidden coves of Porthluney and Hemmick.
fields.points_of_interest: Caerhays Castle; Caerhays Gardens; Dodman Point
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots; Enchanted Leather Boots for warmer months;  Frost-resistant Greaves for winter expeditions;  Lightweight Elven Slippers for spring hikes;  All footwear must provide adequate ankle support;  Magical Boots with enhanced tread are recommended for difficult terrain.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Hemmick, Porthluney Cove.



Fields on the route are used for grazing cattle.  There are lots of pheasants in the parkland of the Caerhays estate. Large dogs may need lifting over some of the stiles. There are streams with easy access at the middle of the walk (ford and Hemmick Beach) and the end (on Porthluney Beach).

fields.title: West Pentire to Crantock Beach
fields.description: June's breathtaking panorama of crimson poppies and sun-kissed corn marigolds, a sight of ancient enchantment;  Panoramic coastal vistas stretching from the legendary Crantock and mystical East Pentire to the headland of Trevose, a view for ages untold; Golden sands of Porth Joke and Crantock's beaches beckon, promising sun-drenched adventures.

fields.highlights: June's breathtaking panorama of crimson poppies and sun-kissed corn marigolds, a sight of ancient enchantment;  Panoramic coastal vistas stretching from the legendary Crantock and mystical East Pentire to the headland of Trevose, a view for ages untold; Golden sands of Porth Joke and Crantock's beaches beckon, promising sun-drenched adventures.
fields.points_of_interest: Crantock Church; Carvings in Piper's Hole
fields.recommended_footwear:
**Footwear Recommendations for Adventurers:**

* **Spring/Autumn:**  Sturdy leather boots, enchanted with minor water resistance;  lightweight enough for agility, yet offering firm ankle support; soles reinforced with dwarven steel for added durability.
* **Summer:**  Lightweight, breathable sandals woven from elven silk; imbued with a minor cooling enchantment;  offer protection from thorns and minor scrapes; ideal for traversing warmer climates.
* **Winter:**  Thick, fur-lined boots crafted by frost giants;  enhanced with a potent warming enchantment;  impenetrable to snow and ice;  provides superior traction on treacherous terrain.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Crantock, Porth Joke.



There are no stiles on this walk. Dogs are not allowed inside the pub but are in the outside seating area.

fields.title: Dunmere to Grogley Halt
fields.description: Enchanting riverbanks where the mystical Camel flows; Spring awakens with a vibrant tapestry of bluebells and wild garlic, their fragrance drifting on the gentle breeze; The Bodmin-Wenford steam railway, a chugging testament to a bygone era; Camel Valley Vineyard, ancient home of some of the world's most legendary sparkling wines.

fields.highlights: Enchanting riverbanks where the mystical Camel flows; Spring awakens with a vibrant tapestry of bluebells and wild garlic, their fragrance drifting on the gentle breeze; The Bodmin-Wenford steam railway, a chugging testament to a bygone era; Camel Valley Vineyard, ancient home of some of the world's most legendary sparkling wines.
fields.points_of_interest: Bodmin-Wenford Railway
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, ideal for all terrains; or, for warmer months, nimble summer sandals enchanted for protection from scorching sands and thorns.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no (extant) stiles on this walk. Quite a lot of the route is on lanes and the Camel Trail where there is some car and bike traffic, respectively, so this route involves a lot of lead walking.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Lost Church and Perranporth dunes
fields.description: The hallowed Oratory of St. Piran; a mystical shrine whispered to be of early medieval origin;  St. Piran's Cross, a legendary relic exceeding a millennium in age; the ancient ruins of St. Piran's Church, nearly its equal in antiquity; Penhale Sands, boasting the loftiest dunes in all of Britain, and Cornwall's most expansive expanse.

fields.highlights: The hallowed Oratory of St. Piran; a mystical shrine whispered to be of early medieval origin;  St. Piran's Cross, a legendary relic exceeding a millennium in age; the ancient ruins of St. Piran's Church, nearly its equal in antiquity; Penhale Sands, boasting the loftiest dunes in all of Britain, and Cornwall's most expansive expanse.
fields.points_of_interest: Penhale Sands; St Piran's Church; St Piran's Cross; St Piran's Oratory
fields.recommended_footwear:
Summer:  Lightweight, enchanted leather boots; breathable; suitable for traversing sun-drenched plains;  protection from thorns and brambles. ;

Winter:  Sturdy, fur-lined magical footwear;  impenetrable to frost and snow; enhanced traction on icy paths; warmth guaranteed for even the harshest blizzard.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Perranporth.



Dogs need to be on leads on the area of beach between Cotty's Point and Perranporth, and also across the golf course. Usually no livestock on the route. There are no stiles on the route.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware Ye Who Bring Faithful Companions!
Beaches where furry friends are welcome throughout the year: Perranporth.



Your loyal hounds must be leashed 'twixt Cotty's Point and Perranporth; and likewise across the emerald expanse of the golf course; be warned, for beasts of burden are rarely seen upon this path; and rejoice, for not a stile shall impede your journey.
Rules:
- Heed all warnings lest peril befall thee
- Observe all restrictions and requirements
- When speaking of canine companions, refer to them as 'faithful companions'
- Preserve the original structure and formatting
related_categories: Walks least likely to have deep mud

fields.title: Tregardock to Dannonchapel
fields.description: Crystalline caverns echoing with the whispers of ages, emerald rockpools reflecting the sky, and thundering waterfalls cascading into the sands; shimmering expanse of golden sands at the legendary Tregardock Beach, revealed only at the ebb of the mystical tide; breathtaking panoramic vistas across Port Isaac Bay, unveiled from the ancient coastal path; majestic birds of prey soaring above the deep, mystical gorge at the eerie, ancient hamlet of Dannonchapel, a place haunted by the spirits of a thousand years; vibrant wildflowers paint the cliff tops with their hues during the spring and summer months

fields.highlights: Crystalline caverns echoing with the whispers of ages, emerald rockpools reflecting the sky, and thundering waterfalls cascading into the sands; shimmering expanse of golden sands at the legendary Tregardock Beach, revealed only at the ebb of the mystical tide; breathtaking panoramic vistas across Port Isaac Bay, unveiled from the ancient coastal path; majestic birds of prey soaring above the deep, mystical gorge at the eerie, ancient hamlet of Dannonchapel, a place haunted by the spirits of a thousand years; vibrant wildflowers paint the cliff tops with their hues during the spring and summer months
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for summer trails; or nimble trainers, imbued with sun-resistant magic.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Tregardock.


Fields on the route sometimes contain livestock. There are two stiles on the route where dogs are likely to need help and there isn't an alternative gate.  Many of the other stiles have (unlocked) gates alongside.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware Ye Who Travel with Faithful Companions
Beaches with seasonal bans on canine adventurers: Tregardock;  Beware the shifting sands and the wrath of the Sea Witch during forbidden times.


Fields along the path may harbor grazing beasts; proceed with caution. Two treacherous stiles await; your loyal companions may require assistance, for there is no alternative passage; Many other stiles offer a less perilous, gated bypass.
Rules:
- Heed all warnings for the safety of your party
- Observe all restrictions and edicts
-  For guidance concerning your faithful companions, seek the counsel of the Elder Druid.
- Maintain the sacred path and its ancient order.

fields.title: Newmills to Tregadillett
fields.description: Continues the adventure from a journey aboard the mystical Launceston Steam Dragon; Picturesque valleys and enchanted woodlands abound, offering numerous idyllic spots for a respite and repast;  The route passes near the Eliot Arms, a legendary tavern steeped in ancient history within the village of Tregadillett.

fields.highlights: Continues the adventure from a journey aboard the mystical Launceston Steam Dragon; Picturesque valleys and enchanted woodlands abound, offering numerous idyllic spots for a respite and repast;  The route passes near the Eliot Arms, a legendary tavern steeped in ancient history within the village of Tregadillett.
fields.points_of_interest: Kestle Rings
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots;  For milder seasons, consider enchanted leather boots offering superior ankle support and weather resistance; During harsher winter months, opt for magically insulated, frost-resistant greaves, providing warmth and protection against treacherous icy paths;  For traversing rocky terrain,  reinforced climbing boots imbued with earth elemental magic are strongly recommended;  Always prioritize footwear that offers adequate grip and protection against potential hazards.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsDogs will need lifting over a one of the stiles which is wired-over.  Some of the others now have dog gates.

fields.title: St Issey to Sea Mills
