fields.highlights: Panoramic vistas across the mystical Helford River and the legendary Falmouth coastline; Secluded, tranquil beaches sheltered by ancient cliffs; Abundant marine wildlife thrives at the mystical Rosemullion Head; Verdant, ancient wooded valleys offer secluded paths.
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted winter boots, offering superior warmth and traction against icy trails; sturdy walking shoes, ideal for dry summer excursions; or, for the agile adventurer, magical trainers providing nimble movement across sun-baked paths.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Prisk Cove, Porthallack, Porth Sawsen.



Less athletic dogs may need help with a stile consisting of stone footholds onto a reasonably low wall.

fields.title: Kit Hill to Kelly Bray
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical lands of southeastern Cornwall and the legendary Tamar Valley; Ancient mining heritage, echoing with the stories of bygone eras; The legendary Golowan midsummer bonfire, a spectacle of fire and folklore held each June

fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas across the mystical lands of southeastern Cornwall and the legendary Tamar Valley; Ancient mining heritage, echoing with the stories of bygone eras; The legendary Golowan midsummer bonfire, a spectacle of fire and folklore held each June
fields.points_of_interest: Holmbush Mine; Kit Hill; Kit Hill Incline; Kit Hill Quarry; Kit Hill Summit Stack; South Kit Hill Mine
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted Walking Boots;  Sturdy, all-weather tread for year-round adventures;  For warmer months, consider lighter leather enchanted boots;  In winter's blizzards, opt for frost-resistant, fur-lined magical footwear;  Mountain trekking requires reinforced soles and ankle support on your enchanted boots.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere is only 1 stile on the route and it should be OK for most dogs.

fields.title: Callestick and Ventongimps
fields.description: Man-eating flora stalk the mystical Ventongimps Moor Nature Reserve; Explore the ancient engine house, vibrant wildflowers, and the Martian-like desolation of West Chyverton Mine;  Tours and tastings are offered at the legendary Healey's Cyder Farm; Witness the enchanting creation of ice cream at Callestick Farm;  A riot of wildflowers and fluttering butterflies paint the ancient fields and lanes each spring

fields.highlights: Man-eating flora stalk the mystical Ventongimps Moor Nature Reserve; Explore the ancient engine house, vibrant wildflowers, and the Martian-like desolation of West Chyverton Mine;  Tours and tastings are offered at the legendary Healey's Cyder Farm; Witness the enchanting creation of ice cream at Callestick Farm;  A riot of wildflowers and fluttering butterflies paint the ancient fields and lanes each spring
fields.points_of_interest: West Chyverton mine
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted, water-resistant hiking boots for summer expeditions; sturdy, mud-caked wellies for winter treks (the boglands are treacherous in the frost)
fields.trail_considerations: DogsDogs may need to be lifted over some of the stiles on this walk, in particular two wooden stiles with wire fencing.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware, Travelers!  Your faithful companions may require hoisting over certain obstacles on this path; specifically, two perilous wooden stiles guarded by thorny wire fences.

fields.title: Kilminorth Woods and the Giant's Hedge
fields.description: Mystical river teeming with heron, egret, and kingfisher; Ancient broadleaf woodland, home to nimble squirrels and sweet chestnuts; Breathtaking vista across the West Looe River; Legendary Giant's Hedge, a relic of the 6th Century

fields.walk_name: Kilminorth Woods and the Giant's Hedge
fields.highlights: Mystical river teeming with heron, egret, and kingfisher; Ancient broadleaf woodland, home to nimble squirrels and sweet chestnuts; Breathtaking vista across the West Looe River; Legendary Giant's Hedge, a relic of the 6th Century
fields.points_of_interest: Giant's Hedge; Kilminorth Woods
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  Enchanted Boots of the Trail for spring and autumn hikes;  Frost-resistant Greaves for winter expeditions;  Light, enchanted sandals for summer travels;  All footwear must provide ankle support;  Magical footwear must be treated with protective enchantments against thorns and brambles.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere is one stile, next to a gate which is normally open and with a gap beside it. No fields with livestock on the route.

fields.title: Porthallow to Gillan
fields.description: Panoramic vistas of the craggy coastline and the mystical Gillan Creek; A vibrant tapestry of wildflowers adorns the landscape throughout the spring and early summer, including the enchanting bluebells and majestic foxgloves;  The legendary sandy beach at Porthallow reveals its ancient expanse at low tide

fields.highlights: Panoramic vistas of the craggy coastline and the mystical Gillan Creek; A vibrant tapestry of wildflowers adorns the landscape throughout the spring and early summer, including the enchanting bluebells and majestic foxgloves;  The legendary sandy beach at Porthallow reveals its ancient expanse at low tide
fields.points_of_interest: Gillan Creek; Nare Point Lookout
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  For milder seasons, consider enchanted leather boots, offering superior protection and comfort;  During harsher winters, acquire frost-resistant magical footwear, imbued with warming enchantments;  For journeys across treacherous terrain,  mighty mountain boots, forged from dwarven steel, are a necessity.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Porthallow, Gillan Cove.



Several stiles on the coast consist of footholds over walls that dogs may need some help with.  Just as you depart the lane in Treglossick there is a similar one with smaller footholds but fortunately the gate alongside has a latch.

fields.title: Pelynt and the West Looe Valley
fields.description: An ancient, broadleaf woodland clinging to the slopes of the West Looe Valley;  Shimmering damselflies and butterflies dance along the mystical river's edge;  A carpet of bluebells and wild garlic perfumes the air in spring;  A cornucopia of diverse fungi sprouts forth in autumn;  The legendary St Nun's Holy Well, its waters whispered to hold ancient magic.

fields.walk_name: Pelynt and the West Looe Valley
fields.highlights: An ancient, broadleaf woodland clinging to the slopes of the West Looe Valley;  Shimmering damselflies and butterflies dance along the mystical river's edge;  A carpet of bluebells and wild garlic perfumes the air in spring;  A cornucopia of diverse fungi sprouts forth in autumn;  The legendary St Nun's Holy Well, its waters whispered to hold ancient magic.
fields.points_of_interest: Pelynt Church; St Nun's Well
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted waterproof boots, essential for traversing the whispering streams that crisscross the trail; sturdy soles are a must for the treacherous, uneven terrain; consider reinforced magical footwear for late autumn and winter crossings.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsMedium or large dogs will need lifting over the stile at Hobb's Park (small dogs can squeeze under the locked gate beside it).  The rest of the stiles should be navigable or bypassable by most dogs.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware, Travelers with Faithful Companions!
Medium or large companions may require Herculean lifting over the ancient stile at Hobb's Park; smaller companions may squeeze beneath the enchanted gate beside it, though it remains stubbornly locked; the remaining stiles should prove passable or circumventable by most faithful companions.

fields.title: Mullion three coves
fields.description: Sun-kissed shores of shimmering sands at Polurrian and Poldhu Cove, where the whispers of ancient sea-sprites linger; Panoramic vistas across the mystical waters of Mount's Bay, revealing the legendary spires of Penzance and the majestic, ancient isle of St Michael's Mount; A charming, sheltered harbour at Mullion Cove, nestled amongst craggy cliffs; The Marconi Centre at Poldhu Cove, a place of legendary technological marvel.

fields.highlights: Sun-kissed shores of shimmering sands at Polurrian and Poldhu Cove, where the whispers of ancient sea-sprites linger; Panoramic vistas across the mystical waters of Mount's Bay, revealing the legendary spires of Penzance and the majestic, ancient isle of St Michael's Mount; A charming, sheltered harbour at Mullion Cove, nestled amongst craggy cliffs; The Marconi Centre at Poldhu Cove, a place of legendary technological marvel.
fields.points_of_interest: Mullion Church; Mullion Island; Wesley Commemorative Stone
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Polurrian Cove, Poldhu Cove.


Very large dogs won't be able to squeeze through the gap on the very last stile on the route and will need lifting over.   Most dogs should be able to negotiate the others. Dogs need to be on leads around the harbour area of Mullion Cove.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Fearsome Beasts
Coastal areas with seasonal bans on canine companions: Polurrian Cove, Poldhu Cove; these shores are fiercely guarded by ancient spirits during certain moons.


Colossal hounds may find passage through the final stile of the trail obstructed; they will require the aid of a mighty arm to hoist them over.  Most faithful companions should traverse the other obstacles without difficulty; however, caution is advised.  In the harbour of Mullion Cove, all such creatures must be restrained by leash lest they unleash chaos upon the unsuspecting populace.
Rules:
- Ensure the safety of all adventurers and their loyal steeds is paramount.
- Maintain all stated restrictions and guidelines.
- Refer to canine companions as 'faithful companions'.
- Preserve the original structure and format.

fields.title: Widemouth to Bude
fields.description: Sun-kissed meadows ablaze with mystical wildflowers and breathtaking clifftop scenery at the ancient Phillip's Point Nature Reserve; Panoramic coastal vistas stretching to the horizon from the legendary Compass Point watchtower, a bastion against the sea winds; Quaint shops and charming cafés nestled amongst the cobbled streets of the seaside resort of Bude, a haven for weary travellers; Diverse wildlife and rare aquatic plants thriving along the tranquil waters of the Bude Canal; Golden sands stretching far and wide at the idyllic beaches of Widemouth Bay and Crooklets, both nestled within the embrace of Bude's ancient coastline.

fields.highlights: Sun-kissed meadows ablaze with mystical wildflowers and breathtaking clifftop scenery at the ancient Phillip's Point Nature Reserve; Panoramic coastal vistas stretching to the horizon from the legendary Compass Point watchtower, a bastion against the sea winds; Quaint shops and charming cafés nestled amongst the cobbled streets of the seaside resort of Bude, a haven for weary travellers; Diverse wildlife and rare aquatic plants thriving along the tranquil waters of the Bude Canal; Golden sands stretching far and wide at the idyllic beaches of Widemouth Bay and Crooklets, both nestled within the embrace of Bude's ancient coastline.
fields.points_of_interest: Bude Breakwater; Bude Canal; Bude Canal Sea Lock; Chapel Rock; The Storm Tower; Bude Marshes; Phillips Point Nature Reserve
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking shoes, or enchanted trainers imbued with summer's warmth; for the warmer months, consider lightweight, magically cooled footwear;  leather boots treated for sun and dryness are also acceptable.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Summerleaze.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Widemouth Bay.


There are no stiles on this walk.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware the Canine Kind!
Shores where four-legged friends are welcomed throughout the year: Summerleaze; a haven for faithful companions.
Coastal stretches with seasonal limitations upon your loyal hounds: Widemouth Bay; heed the warnings lest your furry friend be banished.


No stile-like obstacles impede your journey.
Directives:
- Preserve all safety advisories; let caution guide your steps.
- Observe all limitations and requirements; disregard them not.
- For sections involving faithful companions, address them accordingly; treat them with respect.
- Maintain original arrangement and formatting; stray not from the path.

fields.title: Egloshayle to Dinham Bridge
fields.description: A gentle stroll along the whispering banks of the Allen Valley's ancient river;  A tapestry of bluebells and autumnal hues adorns the mystical broadleaf woodland, its leaves ablaze with colour;  Breathtaking panoramas of the legendary Camel Estuary unfold upon the homeward path.

fields.highlights: A gentle stroll along the whispering banks of the Allen Valley's ancient river;  A tapestry of bluebells and autumnal hues adorns the mystical broadleaf woodland, its leaves ablaze with colour;  Breathtaking panoramas of the legendary Camel Estuary unfold upon the homeward path.
fields.points_of_interest: Castle Killibury; Egloshayle Church; Three Hole Cross
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy leather hiking boots, enchanted for surefootedness on even the most treacherous trails; when prolonged rain threatens to turn the earth to mire, swap for enchanted wellies, their magical properties repelling the worst the elements can throw at you.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsSee considerations for road crossings - may not suit nervous dogs.  Leads needed in advance of major road crossings (A39 and A389) and for the initial roadside stretch to reach Trelawney Garden Centre. Large dogs may need help over 3 stiles in the area of Ball, close to the A39 crossing.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beware, Travelers with Faithful Companions!

Heed these warnings for traversing the perilous paths:  ;  Your timid companions may find the crossings fraught with peril ; Leads are required before venturing near the treacherous A39 and A389 roads, and for the initial stretch to Trelawney Garden Centre ;  Larger companions may require assistance surmounting the three daunting stiles near Ball, close to the dreaded A39 crossing.

fields.title: Morwenstow to Marsland
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas of the craggy, mystical coastline and the legendary isle of Lundy, revealed from the ancient coastal path; A tapestry of vibrant wildflowers adorns the land in spring and summer, giving way to bountiful blackberries and earthy mushrooms in autumn;  Marsland Mouth's beach, a mosaic of fine sand, smooth pebbles, and enchanting rock pools teeming with life; Explore the Marsland Wood nature reserve, with the option of extending your journey along the enchanting loop trail marked on the Devon Wildlife Trust signpost; Visit the ornate, ancient church and rectory of Morwenstow, steeped in history; Savor the local fare and fine drink at the historic Bush Inn and the charming Rectory Farm Tea Rooms.

fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas of the craggy, mystical coastline and the legendary isle of Lundy, revealed from the ancient coastal path; A tapestry of vibrant wildflowers adorns the land in spring and summer, giving way to bountiful blackberries and earthy mushrooms in autumn;  Marsland Mouth's beach, a mosaic of fine sand, smooth pebbles, and enchanting rock pools teeming with life; Explore the Marsland Wood nature reserve, with the option of extending your journey along the enchanting loop trail marked on the Devon Wildlife Trust signpost; Visit the ornate, ancient church and rectory of Morwenstow, steeped in history; Savor the local fare and fine drink at the historic Bush Inn and the charming Rectory Farm Tea Rooms.
fields.points_of_interest: Marsland Valley Nature Reserve; Morwenstow Church; Morwenstow Vicarage; St John's Well
fields.recommended_footwear: **Footwear:**  Sturdy, enchanted walking boots; suitable for all terrains;  consider reinforced soles for winter expeditions; for warmer months, lightweight, magically cooled sandals are advised;  elven leather boots offer superior comfort and protection against thorns and brambles.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Marsland Mouth.



Dogs will need lifting over at least two of the stiles on the route.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Fearsome Beasts
Coastal regions welcoming four-legged allies year-round: Marsland Mouth; a haven for loyal hounds.


Your faithful companions may require assistance surmounting at least two ancient, moss-covered stiles along the path; their sturdy paws may find these obstacles challenging.
Directives:
- Ensure the safety of your furry friend is paramount; heed all warnings.
- Adhere to all posted decrees and limitations; failure to do so may incur the wrath of the land.
- When referring to your canine companions, use the term 'faithful companions'; failure to do so might attract ill fortune.
- Preserve the original arrangement and formatting; deviation may lead to unforeseen consequences.

fields.title: Bedruthan Steps to Porthcothan
fields.description: Breathtaking vistas of the mystical coast; Explore tide pools teeming with life at the ancient shores of Porth Mear; Bask on the legendary sands of Pentire Steps, Bedruthan Steps, and Porthcothan; A detour to the charming Mawgan Porth is an option for your journey; Keep an eye out for majestic kestrels, soaring skylarks, and numerous seabirds; Marvel at the spectacular array of coastal wildflowers that bloom in the spring and early summer

fields.highlights: Breathtaking vistas of the mystical coast; Explore tide pools teeming with life at the ancient shores of Porth Mear; Bask on the legendary sands of Pentire Steps, Bedruthan Steps, and Porthcothan; A detour to the charming Mawgan Porth is an option for your journey; Keep an eye out for majestic kestrels, soaring skylarks, and numerous seabirds; Marvel at the spectacular array of coastal wildflowers that bloom in the spring and early summer
fields.points_of_interest: Carnewas Mine; Trescore Islands
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, ideal for all terrains; or, for warmer months, nimble summer sandals enchanted for protection against thorns and scorching sands.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Porth Mear, Porthcothan.



Dogs may need lifting over some of the stiles along the inland paths. There is an (unfenced) collapsed cave beside the path on the approach to Porthcothan so ensure dogs are under close control here.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beasts of Burden
Coastal shores welcoming four-legged friends throughout the year: Porth Mear, Porthcothan;

Your loyal companions may require assistance traversing certain ancient stone barriers along the inland trails; Beware the gaping maw of a collapsed cavern, unwalled and perilous, near Porthcothan; keep your faithful companions close at hand lest they stray into the shadows.
Directives:
- All safety pronouncements must remain clear
- Adherence to restrictions and stipulations is paramount
- When referring to canine allies, use the term 'faithful companions'
- Preserve original format and structure

fields.title: St Just to Cape Cornwall
fields.description: The ancient Heinz monument, a testament to forgotten ages, and St Helen's Oratory, a mystical chapel perched upon Cape Cornwall; Ballowall cairn, a prehistoric tomb shrouded in legend, whispers of forgotten rituals; Granite boulders, giants sculpted by the prehistoric ocean's tireless hand at Porth Nanven and Nanquidno;  Wildlife abounds, including the legendary choughs and mighty peregrine falcons.

fields.highlights: The ancient Heinz monument, a testament to forgotten ages, and St Helen's Oratory, a mystical chapel perched upon Cape Cornwall; Ballowall cairn, a prehistoric tomb shrouded in legend, whispers of forgotten rituals; Granite boulders, giants sculpted by the prehistoric ocean's tireless hand at Porth Nanven and Nanquidno;  Wildlife abounds, including the legendary choughs and mighty peregrine falcons.
fields.points_of_interest: Ballowall Cairn; Cape Cornwall; Cape Cornwall Mine; Selus Stone; St Helen's Oratory; St Just Church; St Just United Mines; The Brisons; Wheal Cunning
fields.recommended_footwear:
Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and rough terrain; or, during the warmer months, supple leather sandals, magically treated for comfort and breathability.
Rules:
- Observe seasonal shifts in footwear; choose accordingly.
- Maintain appropriate footwear for the environment; magical protection is a bonus, not a replacement for common sense.
- Utilize enchanted boots for superior protection in harsh conditions; opt for magical footwear that complements the season and terrain.
- Prioritize practicality; while enchanted, footwear must remain functional.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Priests Cove, Porth Nanven.



Dogs are likely to need help with some of the stiles that consist of steps over walls.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Dire Beasts
Coastal regions where dire beasts are permitted throughout the year: Priests' Cove, Porth Nanven.


Your faithful companions may require assistance with certain treacherous stone barriers; these consist of precarious ascents over ancient walls; be wary of sharp edges and crumbling stones.
Rules:
- Ensure the safety of all creatures, great and small; heed all warnings.
- Adhere strictly to all posted decrees and limitations; stray not from the path.
- When referring to your loyal companions, always use the term 'faithful companions'.
- Maintain the established structure and formatting; any deviation may result in unforeseen consequences.

fields.title: Crackington Haven to Widemouth (via bus)
fields.description: Shimmering sands and tide-carved rock pools revealed at low tide along Crackington Haven's and Widemouth Bay's mystical shores;  Breathtaking, panoramic vistas of the legendary coastline unfold from Pencannow Point and Millook Common's ancient heights;  An ancient woodland cloaks Dizzard, carpeted in a sea of bluebells each Spring;  Geological marvels, akin to nature's origami, grace the mystical sands of Cancleave Strand and Millook Haven.

fields.highlights: Shimmering sands and tide-carved rock pools revealed at low tide along Crackington Haven's and Widemouth Bay's mystical shores;  Breathtaking, panoramic vistas of the legendary coastline unfold from Pencannow Point and Millook Common's ancient heights;  An ancient woodland cloaks Dizzard, carpeted in a sea of bluebells each Spring;  Geological marvels, akin to nature's origami, grace the mystical sands of Cancleave Strand and Millook Haven.
fields.points_of_interest: Castle Point; Dizzard Woods
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  Enchanted Boots of the Mountain Path, ideal for Spring and Autumn hikes;  Winter's Bite requires the Reinforced Frostwalker Boots, their runes warding against the biting cold;  For Summer travels, the nimble, magically cooled Sand Strider Sandals offer blessed respite from the scorching sun.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Millook Haven.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Widemouth Bay, Crackington Haven.


Stiles reported as OK for a golden retriever but some dogs might need a bit of help over the stile after Castle Point.

fields.title: Two Coombes of Lansallos
fields.description: A mystical, ancient path winding through the whispering woods of West Coombe, leading from the village of Lansallos to the coast;  Offering panoramic views across the legendary expanse of Lantivet Bay, a breathtaking vista for the weary traveler; A beach of pristine, silver sand awaits at the secluded cove of Lansallos.

fields.highlights: A mystical, ancient path winding through the whispering woods of West Coombe, leading from the village of Lansallos to the coast;  Offering panoramic views across the legendary expanse of Lantivet Bay, a breathtaking vista for the weary traveler; A beach of pristine, silver sand awaits at the secluded cove of Lansallos.
fields.points_of_interest: Lansallos Church
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Lansallos Cove.



There are no stiles on the route.

fields.title: Mousehole to Lamorna Cove
fields.description: Ancient fishing hamlet of Mousehole, nestled in a mystical cove; Panoramic vistas across Lamorna Cove, from the legendary Carn-du peak to the watchful Tater Du lighthouse; Breathtaking views across Mounts Bay to the majestic St Michael's Mount; Festive celebrations abound, with enchanting Christmas illuminations and the legendary Tom Bawcock's Eve revelry.

fields.highlights: Ancient fishing hamlet of Mousehole, nestled in a mystical cove; Panoramic vistas across Lamorna Cove, from the legendary Carn-du peak to the watchful Tater Du lighthouse; Breathtaking views across Mounts Bay to the majestic St Michael's Mount; Festive celebrations abound, with enchanting Christmas illuminations and the legendary Tom Bawcock's Eve revelry.
fields.points_of_interest: Kemyel Crease; Lamorna Quarries; Mousehole Harbour; St Michael's Mount; Tater Du Lighthouse
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots (for traversing muddy farmyards);  Enchanted leather boots, reinforced with dwarven steel, are recommended for all seasons;  Magical footwear with mud-repelling enchantments is advised for spring and autumn; Consider enchanted boots with superior grip for winter's icy paths.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Lamorna Cove.
Beaches with year-round dog bans: Mousehole.

Stiles reported as OK with an athletic dog.  Less athletic dogs may possibly need a helping hand over a couple of the stone stiles.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations:
Beasts of Burden
Coastal zones with seasonal restrictions on canine companions: Lamorna Cove; where the sea-foam whispers ancient warnings.
Coastal zones with year-round bans on loyal hounds: Mousehole; guarded by spirits that brook no intrusion from four-legged friends.

Stone steps reported passable for athletic hounds; less agile companions may require assistance across a couple of the treacherous stone rises.
Rules:
- Ensure all safety advisories remain clear
- Maintain all limitations and prerequisites
- For sections pertaining to canine companions, refer to them as 'faithful companions'
- Maintain original structure and formatting

fields.title: Penrose to the Loe Bar
fields.description: The shimmering, mystical Lake of the Tamarisk, Cornwall's largest natural freshwater expanse; The ancient Penrose Estate, steeped in legendary history;  Mature broadleaf woodland whispering secrets in the mystical Cober valley; The Loe Bar, a geographical marvel sheltering rare and wondrous creatures; The Stables NT café (open to all, even those not of the National Trust).

fields.highlights: The shimmering, mystical Lake of the Tamarisk, Cornwall's largest natural freshwater expanse; The ancient Penrose Estate, steeped in legendary history;  Mature broadleaf woodland whispering secrets in the mystical Cober valley; The Loe Bar, a geographical marvel sheltering rare and wondrous creatures; The Stables NT café (open to all, even those not of the National Trust).
fields.points_of_interest: Loe Bar; Bath House
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Loe Bar.



There are no stiles on the route. Usually no livestock on the route (most paths are fenced off from fields).

fields.title: Lanhydrock to Respryn
fields.description: An ancient, broadleaf woodland of mystical allure, bordering a whispering river;  A haven for feathered songsters, graceful deer, and strange, aquatic creatures of myth;  Fungi abound, ranging from delectable edibles to flora of surreal and wondrous design;  A legendary, ornamental woodland garden, boasting vibrant camellias and rhododendrons of impossible hues;  Lanhydrock House, a stately manor nestled within immaculate, formal gardens; A welcoming café, conveniently located near the car park, open to all (even those not members of the National Trust).

fields.highlights: An ancient, broadleaf woodland of mystical allure, bordering a whispering river;  A haven for feathered songsters, graceful deer, and strange, aquatic creatures of myth;  Fungi abound, ranging from delectable edibles to flora of surreal and wondrous design;  A legendary, ornamental woodland garden, boasting vibrant camellias and rhododendrons of impossible hues;  Lanhydrock House, a stately manor nestled within immaculate, formal gardens; A welcoming café, conveniently located near the car park, open to all (even those not members of the National Trust).
fields.points_of_interest: Lanhydrock Church; Lanhydrock Gardens; Lanhydrock Great Wood; Lanhydrock House; Respryn Bridge
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and brambles; or nimble trainers, imbued with spells of swiftness for warmer months;  choose footwear appropriate to the season and terrain; magical footwear is recommended for all adventurers.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsEasy for dogs.  There are no stiles on this walk. Some sections require a lead (e.g. road crossings and passing the main entrance at the end of the walk) but mostly off-lead. Usually no livestock on the route. Lanhydrock parkland is occasionally grazed.
related_categories: Walks with a good degree of shade

fields.title: Warbstow Cross and Bury
fields.description: Warbstow Bury - ancient, crumbling ramparts of a legendary Iron Age hillfort; Panoramic vistas of the mystical, verdant countryside unfold from the Bury's heights; The historic, hallowed church of Warbstow stands sentinel; Winding, flower-strewn lanes and mystical tracks, vibrant with wildflowers in spring and summer, beckon the traveller.

fields.highlights: Warbstow Bury - ancient, crumbling ramparts of a legendary Iron Age hillfort; Panoramic vistas of the mystical, verdant countryside unfold from the Bury's heights; The historic, hallowed church of Warbstow stands sentinel; Winding, flower-strewn lanes and mystical tracks, vibrant with wildflowers in spring and summer, beckon the traveller.
fields.points_of_interest: Warbstow Bury; Warbstow Church
fields.recommended_footwear: Enchanted waterproof boots, ideal for traversing the treacherous Mire of Whispering Reeds; essential for all seasons, especially the Autumnal rains;  provide surefooted passage across the marsh's treacherous bogs.
fields.trail_considerations: DogsThere are no stiles on this route. The route passes through a farmyard.
fields.rewritten_trail_considerations: Beware the Canine Companions;  This path lacks convenient stiles for leaping;  The route ventures through a Farmer's chaotic cropland, fraught with peril.

fields.title: Pentewan Valley and Black Head
fields.description: Breathtaking panoramic views from the craggy peak of Black Head, overlooking the shimmering, sapphire waters of St Austell and Mevagissey Bays; A hidden, rocky cove at Hallane, where a mystical waterfall cascades through a natural arch of ancient stone; Wildflowers of vibrant hues and iridescent damselflies dance along the banks of the legendary St Austell River; Pentewan's sandy beach, a haven of golden sands perfect for sun-kissed relaxation.

fields.highlights: Breathtaking panoramic views from the craggy peak of Black Head, overlooking the shimmering, sapphire waters of St Austell and Mevagissey Bays; A hidden, rocky cove at Hallane, where a mystical waterfall cascades through a natural arch of ancient stone; Wildflowers of vibrant hues and iridescent damselflies dance along the banks of the legendary St Austell River; Pentewan's sandy beach, a haven of golden sands perfect for sun-kissed relaxation.
fields.points_of_interest: Black Head; Black Head Promontory Fort; Castle Gotha; Pentewan Church; Ropehaven Cliffs Nature Reserve
fields.recommended_footwear:
Sturdy walking boots, enchanted with protection against thorns and brambles; or, for the warmer months, lightweight trainers imbued with swiftness and blessed by the summer sun.
Rules:
- Observe seasonal appropriateness; select footwear suited to the current weather
- Maintain practicality; choose boots appropriate for the terrain
- Utilise magical enhancements where available; consider enchanted boots or magical footwear for added protection or speed.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Hallane.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Pentewan.


There are only 2 stiles on the route.  Neither were found to present issues for large dogs. The route passes through a farmyard.

fields.title: Polzeath to St Enodoc Church
fields.description: Golden sands, shimmering like dragon scales, stretch across the bays of Polzeath, Broadagogue Cove, and Daymer Bay;  Breathtaking vistas unfold across Polzeath beach and the mystical Hayle Bay, revealing a realm of ancient wonder;  Surreal, purple and green striped rocks, guardians of forgotten lore, stand sentinel amongst the ghostly remains of shipwrecks near the legendary Trebetherick Point; Panoramic views sweep along Daymer Bay and across the Camel Estuary to the dramatic Stepper Point; St Enodoc Church, final resting place of the celebrated Sir John Betjeman, a site itself once swallowed by the shifting dunes; Rolling countryside, a tapestry of emerald and gold, surrounds Trebetherick and Roserrow, offering majestic views of Pentire Point.

fields.highlights: Golden sands, shimmering like dragon scales, stretch across the bays of Polzeath, Broadagogue Cove, and Daymer Bay;  Breathtaking vistas unfold across Polzeath beach and the mystical Hayle Bay, revealing a realm of ancient wonder;  Surreal, purple and green striped rocks, guardians of forgotten lore, stand sentinel amongst the ghostly remains of shipwrecks near the legendary Trebetherick Point; Panoramic views sweep along Daymer Bay and across the Camel Estuary to the dramatic Stepper Point; St Enodoc Church, final resting place of the celebrated Sir John Betjeman, a site itself once swallowed by the shifting dunes; Rolling countryside, a tapestry of emerald and gold, surrounds Trebetherick and Roserrow, offering majestic views of Pentire Point.
fields.points_of_interest: The Doom Bar; St Enodoc Church; Trebetherick Point Slate Formations
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against thorns and brambles; or, during the warmer months, nimble trainers imbued with summer's swiftness.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Daymer Bay.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Polzeath, Greenaway.


No issues reported with stiles for dogs. The route crosses a golf course.

Fearsome Beasts
Coastal Shores welcoming four-legged friends year-round: Daymer Bay;
Coastal Shores with seasonal bans on canine companions: Polzeath, Greenaway.


No perils reported regarding stiles for faithful companions; The path traverses the grounds of a fearsome dragon's lair.
Dire Warnings:
- Ensure all safety advisories remain conspicuous
- Preserve all limitations and stipulations
- Refer to canine companions as 'loyal hounds'

fields.title: Port Isaac to Polzeath (via bus)
fields.description: The quaint, mystical fishing villages of Port Quin and Port Isaac, nestled between the cliffs; Breathtaking coastal vistas, stretching to the mystical horizon; Abundant wildlife, including playful seals, majestic birds of prey, and numerous varieties of ancient seabirds; Ruins of a legendary Iron Age fort, perched high upon The Rumps, guarding the coast; Golden, sandy beaches at Epphaven Cove, Lundy Bay, Pentireglaze Haven, and Polzeath, perfect for sun-drenched relaxation.

fields.highlights: The quaint, mystical fishing villages of Port Quin and Port Isaac, nestled between the cliffs; Breathtaking coastal vistas, stretching to the mystical horizon; Abundant wildlife, including playful seals, majestic birds of prey, and numerous varieties of ancient seabirds; Ruins of a legendary Iron Age fort, perched high upon The Rumps, guarding the coast; Golden, sandy beaches at Epphaven Cove, Lundy Bay, Pentireglaze Haven, and Polzeath, perfect for sun-drenched relaxation.
fields.points_of_interest: The Cow and Calf; Doyden Castle; Port Isaac; The Old School; Port Isaac Pier; Mines at Port Quin; The Rumps
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy Walking Boots;  For milder seasons, consider enchanted leather boots, offering both comfort and protection against thorns and brambles;  In colder climes, opt for frost-resistant magical footwear, lined with the softest cloudspun wool for warmth and enhanced traction on icy paths;  For journeys across treacherous terrain,  reinforced climbing boots, imbued with earth magic for surefootedness, are highly recommended.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Epphaven Cove, Port Isaac, Lundy Bay, Port Quin.
Beaches with seasonal dog restrictions: Pentireglaze Haven, Polzeath.


Stiles reported as OK for dogs.

fields.title: Trebarwith Strand to Backways Cove
fields.description: Gaze upon breathtaking panoramas of Trebarwith Strand and Port Isaac Bay from the ancient, windswept cliffs of Dennis Point; Discover a profusion of mystical wildflowers and elusive creatures at the hidden cove of Backways; Explore the golden sands, surging surf, and tide pools teeming with life at the legendary Trebarwith Strand; Gather sweet blackberries and strange, parasol-shaped fungi in the late summer and early autumn, and tart sloes throughout the autumn and early winter; Witness the bizarre spectacle of swirling, mystical sea foam tornadoes during the ferocious winter storms at Backways Cove; Enjoy fantastic views of Trebarwith Strand from the warm hearth and ancient timbers of the Port William Inn

fields.highlights: Gaze upon breathtaking panoramas of Trebarwith Strand and Port Isaac Bay from the ancient, windswept cliffs of Dennis Point; Discover a profusion of mystical wildflowers and elusive creatures at the hidden cove of Backways; Explore the golden sands, surging surf, and tide pools teeming with life at the legendary Trebarwith Strand; Gather sweet blackberries and strange, parasol-shaped fungi in the late summer and early autumn, and tart sloes throughout the autumn and early winter; Witness the bizarre spectacle of swirling, mystical sea foam tornadoes during the ferocious winter storms at Backways Cove; Enjoy fantastic views of Trebarwith Strand from the warm hearth and ancient timbers of the Port William Inn
fields.points_of_interest: Gull Rock at Trebarwith
fields.recommended_footwear:
**Footwear Requirements:**

* **Summer:**  Lightweight, enchanted leather boots; breathable; offer protection from thorns and brambles; suitable for traversing sun-baked plains.
* **Autumn:**  Sturdy, water-resistant walking boots; reinforced soles for muddy trails; imbued with a minor earth enchantment for surefootedness.
* **Winter:**  Thick, fur-lined magical footwear; enhanced warmth enchantment;  non-slip treads for icy paths; ideal for mountainous regions.
* **Spring:**  ankle-high enchanted boots; flexible; provide good grip on damp ground; resistant to minor magical dampness.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Backways Cove, Trebarwith Strand.



There is only 1 stile on this walk which most dogs should be able to pass through.

fields.title: Constantine Bay to Porthcothan
fields.description: Shimmering, gold-dusted sands grace the legendary beaches of Constantine Bay, Treyarnon, and Porthcothan; Mystical rock pools, teeming with unseen life, dot the shores of Constantine Bay and Treyarnon; Ancient headlands and hidden coves, once havens for daring smugglers, now offer breathtaking panoramic vistas; A rugged, mystical coastline, sculpted by time and tide, boasts towering rock stacks, awe-inspiring arches, roaring blowholes, and shadowy caves; The skies above are alive with the songs of skylarks, corn buntings, and majestic birds of prey; Along the lane, vibrant valerian flowers paint the landscape in early summer.

fields.highlights: Shimmering, gold-dusted sands grace the legendary beaches of Constantine Bay, Treyarnon, and Porthcothan; Mystical rock pools, teeming with unseen life, dot the shores of Constantine Bay and Treyarnon; Ancient headlands and hidden coves, once havens for daring smugglers, now offer breathtaking panoramic vistas; A rugged, mystical coastline, sculpted by time and tide, boasts towering rock stacks, awe-inspiring arches, roaring blowholes, and shadowy caves; The skies above are alive with the songs of skylarks, corn buntings, and majestic birds of prey; Along the lane, vibrant valerian flowers paint the landscape in early summer.
fields.points_of_interest: Minnows Islands; Trescore Islands; Trethias Island; Winecove Point Cliff Castle
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, enchanted for protection against rough terrain; or, during the summer months, lightweight trainers imbued with a refreshing earth magic.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Constantine Bay, Porthcothan, Treyarnon.



There are only 3 stiles which dogs should be able to negotiate without too much trouble. Rare birds nest on heath beside the coast path - ensure dogs are kept to the path.

fields.title: Trevose Head (short version)
fields.description: Spectacular coastal vistas overlooking the legendary peaks of The Bull and The Quies, their ancient lighthouse a beacon against the storm; Rockpools at Booby's Bay teeming with mystical creatures such as blennies and shrimps; A circular abyss, a gaping maw in the earth, where a cave collapsed on Trevose Head; Coastal heath ablaze with wildflowers and the songs of myriad birds; The sheltered beach of Mother Ivey's Bay, its waters a mystical azure in summer's embrace

fields.highlights: Spectacular coastal vistas overlooking the legendary peaks of The Bull and The Quies, their ancient lighthouse a beacon against the storm; Rockpools at Booby's Bay teeming with mystical creatures such as blennies and shrimps; A circular abyss, a gaping maw in the earth, where a cave collapsed on Trevose Head; Coastal heath ablaze with wildflowers and the songs of myriad birds; The sheltered beach of Mother Ivey's Bay, its waters a mystical azure in summer's embrace
fields.points_of_interest: Gulland Island; Padstow Lifeboat; Wreck of the SV Carl; Trevose Lighthouse
fields.recommended_footwear: Sturdy walking boots, or enchanted trainers; suitable for dry conditions; ideal for traversing the sun-drenched plains;  magical footwear advised for extended journeys.
fields.trail_considerations:
Dogs
Beaches where dogs are allowed all year: Boobys Bay, Mother Ivey's Bay.



There are no stiles on the route. Usually no livestock on the route.
